title: Director, People Operations
description: Grow with us... Life at Starwood Hotels is based on a simple idea: the world is beautiful and we want to keep it that way. But we can’t do it alone. That’s why hiring thoughtful and inspiring Team Members and Leaders who understand that our people, collaboration, stellar service, and respect for nature are so important to us. Our People Teams play an integral role in every aspect of our hotels. They are responsible for recruiting (and retaining) the best talent and then keeping them happy. And each one of our amazing People members keeps us humble and focused. We’re currently searching for a Director of People Operations, who will be the guru of People, processes and programs.The Director of People Operations is the key to a high-performance culture that emphasizes our brand mission and point of view, as well as upholds ambitious standards for every team member, sets them up to attain challenging goals and evolves the workforce and SH culture through ongoing development and ever-evolving needs of the hotel.Development of the Human Resources DepartmentMonitors administration to established standards and procedures. Identifies opportunities for improvement and resolves any discrepancies.Oversees and manages the work and development of the People Operations staff.Develops and monitors an annual budget that includes People Operations services, employee recognition, sports teams support, company philanthropic giving, and administration.Conducts a continuing study of all People Operations policies, programs, and practices to keep management informed of new developments.Leads the development of department goals, objectives, and systems.Establishes departmental measurements that support the accomplishment of the company's strategic goals.Develops and administers programs, procedures, and guidelines to help align the workforce with the strategic goals of the company.Participates in executive, management, and company team meetings.Human Resources Information Systems HRISManages and maintains participation on Beekeeper, recruiting, culture and sharing key information.Training and DevelopmentDefines all People Operations training programs and assigns the authority / responsibility of People Operations and managers within those programs.Leads the implementation of the performance management system that includes performance development plans .EmploymentEstablishes and leads the recruiting practices and procedures necessary to recruit and hire a superior workforce.Interviews management- and executive-level candidates; serves as an interviewer for position finalists.Employee RelationsFormulates and recommends People Operations policies and objectives for the company with regard to employee relations.Partners with management to communicate People Operations policies, procedures, programs and laws.Determines and recommends employee relations practices necessary to establish a positive employer-employee relationship and promote a high level of employee morale and motivation.Conducts investigations when employee complaints or concerns are brought forth.Monitors and advises managers and supervisors in the progressive discipline system of the company.Reviews, guides, and approves management recommendations for employment terminations.Leads the implementation of company safety and health programs.CompensationLeads competitive market research to establish pay practices to attract, recruit and retain talent.Monitors all pay practices and systems for effectiveness and cost containment.BenefitsLeads the development of benefit orientations and other benefit training.LawLeads company compliance with all existing governmental and labor legal and government reporting requirements including any related to the Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO), the Americans With Disabilities Act (ADA), the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA), the Department of Labor, worker compensation, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), and so forth. Maintains minimal company exposure to lawsuits.Protects the interests of employees and the company in accordance with company People Operations policies and governmental laws and regulations.Organization DevelopmentDesigns and directs and manages a company-wide process of organization development that addresses issues such as succession planning, superior workforce development, key employee retention, organization design, and change management.Manages employee communication and feedback through such avenues as company meetings, suggestion programs, employee satisfaction surveys, monthly Listening sessions, employee focus groups and one-on-one meetings.Directs a process of organizational planning that evaluates company structure, job design, and personnel forecasting throughout the company.Promotes a culture of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. Identifies and monitors the organization's culture so that it supports the attainment of the company's goals and promotes employee satisfaction’s culture so that it supports the attainment of the company's goals and promotes employee satisfaction.Manages the company-wide committees including the wellness, training, environmental health and safety, activity, and culture and communications committees.Encourages community activities and acts as a strong liaison with hotel schools thus creating Internship opportunities for talented students.About you...Minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Human Resources or Business.Experience in luxury hotels as Assistant Director of People operations or Director for a minimum of five yearsExperience working with ADP Workforce Now is a plus.Active affiliation with appropriate Human Resources networks and organizations and ongoing community involvement preferred.Broad knowledge and experience in employment law, compensation, organizational planning, organization development, employee relations, safety, and training and development.Strong oral and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal and coaching skills.Strong organizational skills. Salary range: $190,000-$200,000 About us... As a mission-driven company, our purpose is our true north, and our compass guides the way. The purpose we live by impacts the lives of our team members, drives the experiences for our guests, builds community with like-minded travelers and takes care of the planet we live in. Founded in 2006 by Barry Sternlicht, Starwood Hotels is a luxury hotel brand management company and affiliate of global private investment firm Starwood Capital Group. Starwood Hotels is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in a diverse, sustainable workforce with an empowered, inclusive culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis covered under applicable law. If you require any special accommodations, please visit People Operations. title: People Operations Generalist
description: Are you looking for an opportunity to further your experience in the People Operations (Human Resources) field while having a meaningful impact on people’s lives? Do you have outstanding knowledge, understanding, and expertise in employee relations dealing with things such as leave of absences, coaching employees and management through issues, benefits and workers compensation? Are you an enthusiastic go-getter, seeking a role that allows you to function as a key member of the People Operations team? If you answered Yes, then you’ll enjoy working as a People Operations Generalist at Devereux. Being a People Operations (Human Resources) Generalist at Devereux/TCV Community Services has its Advantages You will work with other dedicated professionals who share your passion for helping individuals in need. This Generailist primary focus will be employee benefits and leave of abscences We offer: A unique opportunity where the work you perform will support Devereux/TCV’s People Operations Department, resulting in contributions that have relevance to the provision of services to individuals. A supportive team collegial work atmosphere with the ability to deliver high-quality People Operations needed to support decisions. The ability to serve as a servant leader in a collaborative environment with supportive leadership, while having an opportunity to make a significant impact in our organization. A chance to grow and advance your skills in People Operations Excellent benefits including low-cost, high coverage health insurance, generous time-off benefits, retirement, tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance AND MORE! Salary up to $68,921 per year Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health/TCV Community Services provides programs and services for adults, children and adolescents. Located in the Pittsburgh Metropolitan Region, this position is responsible for primarily administering and managing Devereux/TCV Community Services' employee benefits and leave of absence policies, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations. In addition, as a People Operations Generalist, the incumbent will serve as a point of contact for all HR employee inquiries and provide guidance on policies and procedures. As a key member of the People Operations team, the People Operations Generalist will have a lead role in administering and managing Devereux/TCV Community Services' employee benefits programs and leaves of absence policies, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations. This will include processing enrollments, changes, and claims related to benefits (including unemployment and workers’ compensation claims), as well as managing employee leaves of absence, including FMLA and other leave of absence types. This role will review benefits, competitor benefits, and benefit utilization and make recommendations to assure a strong employee value proposition. Furthermore, the generalist will assist with employee performance management, leadership consultation, and provide general People Operations support as needed. What is People Operations?Today, many businesses are moving toward the term “People Operations,” as this function is viewed as an equal partner across business lines. Truly, an organization’s employee workforce requires the same strategic approach and vision as its other core business functions. So, whereas HR functions are more narrowed in scope, People Operations is more strategic and data-driven, placing purposeful focus on people and culture, and working to build a sense of community among colleagues. At Devereux, our goal is to serve as a valued and trusted strategic partner, helping centers/departments make the best possible people-based decisions that will benefit employees, the individuals we serve and the overall organization. Interested in advancing your career?Devereux is proud to offer ASCEND - the first career accelerator program exclusively designed to give behavioral healthcare workers - the career guidance, one-on-one coaching, skills and financial assistance you need to reach your full potential. This program includes100%of tuition covered (up to$15kreimbursed annually for undergraduate and$25kreimbursed annually for graduate) and student loan repayment! Learn more here. Keywords: Human Resources, Human Resouces Generalist, Human Resources Specialist, Human Resources Business Partner. Bachelor’s degree in human resources or a related field; SPHR or PHR certification preferred. A minimum of three (3) years of Human Resources Generalist experience with a focus on benefits and leaves. Knowledge of all federal and state laws and regulatory compliance. Must have the ability to make recommendation to effectively resolve problems or issues, by using judgment that is consistent with standards, practices, policies, procedures, regulation or government law. Ability to objectively coach employees and management through complex, difficult, and emotional issues. Strong knowledge and understanding of insurance regulations, plan designs and third party record keeping/administration required. Familiarity with COBRA, ERISA, FMLA and related state and federal regulations required. Background in employment law and other government compliance regulations preferred. Strong organizational skills. Ability to manage multiple tasks. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of the organization. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proficient computer skills, mastery of Microsoft Office applications and ability to learn HRIS systems Devereux has a zero-tolerance policy for abuse and maintains policies and procedures to systematically reduce the risk of abuse to occur in our organization. Devereux fosters a culture of reporting abuse, and will cooperate with the authorities to the fullest extent possible. #SPONSORED Company Overview Devereux is one of the nation’s largest nonprofit organizations, providing services, insight and leadership in the evolving field of behavioral healthcare. Founded in 1912, Devereux operates a comprehensive national network of clinical, therapeutic, educational and employment programs that positively impact the lives of 10,000+ children, adults – and their families – every year. Our Mission:Devereux changes lives – by unlocking and nurturing human potential for people living with emotional, behavioral or cognitive differences. With nearly 6,500 employees working in programs across the country, Devereux is a trusted partner for families, schools and communities, serving individuals in the areas of autism, intellectual and developmental disabilities, specialty mental health, education and foster care. Our Culture, Our Expectations At Devereux, Servant Leadership is embedded throughout our culture and every aspect of our organizational framework. Our mission-driven, people-first mindset is at the heart of the compassionate and high-quality programming we provide – every day – for the individuals and families we serve, and other key stakeholders. Devereux offers challenging and exciting work, and our team environment creates an empowering, positive and rewarding atmosphere. To be successful at Devereux, you will: put the needs of others first, feel called to serve and called to lead. As a member of our team, you will be a significant part of our commitment to providing a welcoming and supportive work environment across all programs and services, and within all policies and employee practices. We believe a workplace rooted in inclusivity – offering a sense of belonging to all those who walk through our doors – is fundamental to delivering the highest quality healthcare services. Through open dialogue and the creation of brave spaces, we will engage in work that gives each of us a chance to change the world – one person, one family, one community at a time. What Devereux Offers You In addition to a competitive salary, Devereux provides a comprehensive health and welfare program to eligible full-time employees, family members

title: People Operations Administrator
description: Join us in Telling the Stories of Santa’s North Pole!The Lumistella Company is a global intellectual property company dedicated to bringing Santa’s North Pole to life for children around the world through consumer products, original entertainment and brand experiences. We are home to the most iconic and beloved Christmas brands of this generation including The Elf on the Shelf, Elf Pets, and Elf Mates. ThePeople Operations Administratoris responsible for managing various administrative and operational functions to support the People Operations team. This position manages essential day-to-day tasks such as onboarding and offboarding logistics, employee engagement activities, recordkeeping, event support, overseeing product requests for new hires, and assisting in coordinating employee welfare events. The People Operations Administrator supports the People Operations and Administrative teams, and takes on project work as needed throughout the year. This role is crucial to fostering an efficient, supportive, and engaging work environment, helping the company maintain high standards of employee experience and operational effectiveness. The dynamic nature of this role requires that the ideal incumbent has a willingness to roll up their sleeves and do whatever needs to be done. The role must interact seamlessly and with a professional demeanor across a broad range of individuals. As a member of the team supporting our most sensitive operational areas, this role requires high levels of professionalism and discretion in the performance of duties. ThePeople Operations Administratorwill:Administrative & Operational Support Manage documentation, scheduling, and logistics for People Operations programs and processes. Prepare and maintain employee files, process documentation, and compliance reporting. Assist with onboarding and offboarding tasks, ensuring a positive experience for new hires and smooth transitions for departing employees. Provide recruiting support, including posting jobs, scheduling interviews, coordinating with candidates and hiring managers, and maintaining applicant tracking records. Coordinate logistics for employee engagement activities, including staff meetings and welfare events. Support planning and execution (setup, catering, recording, etc.) of company events (holiday parties, flu-clinic, in-office gatherings, etc.). Assist with the annual corporate holiday gift program and employee recognition initiatives. Assist in the planning and implementation of employee wellness initiatives and programs. Partner with the People Operations team to support welfare activities monthly. Stay within budget but maintain the activities calendar and focus on employee engagement and development. title: People Operations Specialist
description: The People Operations Specialist will be a part of the People Operations team, and report to the Associate Director of People Operations. The People Operations Specialist will be responsible for managing full-cycle recruiting and talent acquisition, ensuring a seamless and positive candidate experience, and partnering with hiring managers to attract top talent. In addition to talent acquisition, you will support broader PeopleOps functions including onboarding, employee engagement, and HR administration. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is passionate about people and the employee experience. We require employees to be present in the office Monday-Wednesday and offer flexibility to WFH Thursday/Friday. Youhavealready accomplished (required): · Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource, Business Administration or related · At least 3+ years of full life cycle recruiting experience · At least 3+ years of general HR support WhatYOUare good at: · Can communicate with all styles to foster ever improving teamwork · Is organized for productivity and efficiency, yet flexes to anticipate and meet the needs of others · Makes thoughtful, creative, and timely decisions after analyzing situations · Stays current. Collaborate with hiring managers to develop and update job descriptions, job postings, and recruitment strategies. Use a variety of sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, networking, employee referrals, and recruitment agencies. Coordinate and participate in job fairs, career events, and other talent outreach initiatives. Develop relationships with local universities. Develop and maintain a talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs. Track and analyze recruitment metrics (e.g., time-to-fill, quality of hire) to improve processes. Ensure a seamless and positive candidate experience from application to onboarding. General HR Support Assist in onboarding new employees, ensuring all documentation and orientation processes are completed. Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records in the HRIS system. Support HR initiatives such as employee engagement, performance management, and training programs. Assist in ensuring compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations. Participate in HR projects and initiatives to enhance organizational effectiveness. title: Head of People Operations
description: Hillsong Church exists to build a healthy church and changing lives through Christ through building healthy church communities, developing purpose-filled Jesus followers, and creating significant and sustainable social impact. If you are passionate about playing a part in driving strategic people practices, and fostering an environment where staff thrive, this could be the opportunity for you.This role offers location flexibility and can be based at any Hillsong Church location globally. Hillsong Global team is looking for a Head of People Operations to oversee the development and delivery of our global People Operations initiatives that support Hillsong's vision and help shape how we care for, grow and engage our global team. If your application is successful, your main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Leadership Provide strategic leadership of People Operations in alignment with Hillsong’s vision, priorities and organizational needs. Serve as a trusted advisor to the Global Chief Operating Officer and church leadership, offering expertise in workforce strategy, organizational design, succession planning, risk management and employee relations. Champion and drive continuous innovation in People practice supporting the evolving needs of a global, mission-driven organization. Drive strategic workforce planning, succession, talent acquisition, retention, and leadership development initiatives. People Operations Programs, Policies and Compliance Oversee globally consistent yet regionally adaptable People Operations programs, ensuring efficiency, compliance, and alignment with Hillsong’s mission. Develop and implement comprehensive plans for recruitment, performance development, and learning and development. Lead the development of a compelling Employer Value Proposition (EVP) to support global team engagement and retention. Guide the development of compensation, benefits, and recognition frameworks that reflect Hillsong’s values and financial stewardship. Utilize data and analytics to provide actionable insights into workforce trends and opportunities for improvement. Ensure governance, compliance, and ethical integrity across all locations. Employee Experience and Well-Being Provide guidance on employee relations matters, ensuring fair and compliant resolution in alignment with Hillsong values and culture. Coach managers in performance management best practices, including goal setting, feedback, and professional development. Lead and oversee complex workplace investigations and employee relations, ensuring Hillsong upholds integrity, compliance and a people-first approach. Champion employee well-being, developing initiatives that support holistic workplace wellness. Global Mobility and Collaboration Develop and lead strategies that support global mobility, including cross-border assignments, remote work structures, and international team integration. Foster unity and strengthen bonds among global teams through initiatives that promote connection, collaboration and shared purpose. Culture and Leadership Development Lead and implement leadership learning and development initiatives to equip and empower leaders at all levels of the organization. Embed Hillsong’s values and mission in all aspects of people practices and organizational culture. Drive unity and belonging initiatives alongside the Unity and Belonging Advisory Committee. Ideally, a successful candidate will have: Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Organizational Development, Business, or related field. Master’s degree or relevant certifications (e.g., SHRM-SCP, CIPD, CHRL) preferred. 15+ years of progressive HR leadership experience, including 5+ years in a senior strategic role in a global, multi-site organization. Experience in a church, nonprofit, or faith-based context is desirable but not essential. Proven success in leading People Operations functions across recruitment, performance management, learning and development, compensation and benefits, and employee engagement. Familiarity with global employment laws, HR systems, and international workforce planning. Skills & Competencies Strategic Thinking – Ability to see the big picture and translate it into impactful People strategies. Change Management – Skilled in guiding organizations through transformation with care and clarity. Collaboration & Influence – Strong communicator who builds trust across all levels of the organization. People-Centered Innovation – Committed to continuous improvement in people programs and practices. Integrity & Emotional Intelligence – Approaches leadership with humility, discernment, and empathy. Conflict Management – Handles conflict situations and defuses high-tension effectively Decision Quality – Ability to consider all relevant factors to make good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Applications close: 29 August 2025, 5.00pm ET If you would like to know how your data is being used, please refer to our . title: People Operations Coordinator
description: Join Our Team as a People Operations Coordinator! Are you passionate about supporting people, processes, and a growing company culture? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where no two days are the same? We’re looking for a People Operations Coordinator to help keep our teams running smoothly and ensure every employee has an exceptional experience from day one—and beyond. This is more than an admin role—you’ll be at the heart of our people operations, payroll, onboarding, and office coordination. And the best part? There’s room to grow with us as our company expands internationally. About Infravision Infravision is a high growth technology enabled services company specializing in aerial robotics and software solutions for the transmission industry with a focus on increasing grid capacity and automating power line construction. Infravision’s mission is to deliver solutions to modernize and decarbonise the power grid and accelerate the world’s transition to renewable energy transition. Trusted by some of the world’s largest electric utility companies, Infravision’s technologies and services are at the cutting edge of transmission and power grid modernization and digitisation. This is an exciting time to join Infravision as we are scaling our business globally. Infravision operates across Australia, the United States of America and most recently India. There are lots of opportunities for you to have an influence and impact from day one. At Infravision we aim to have a positive impact on our people, customers and the environment. Why Join Us Join a mission driven organization and make a meaningful impact on climate change and decarbonising the global electric grid. Be a key part of a growing, international company with opportunities to expand your career. Work closely with a collaborative, supportive team that values people and culture. Gain exposure to all aspects of HR, payroll, and operations across multiple regions. Help shape processes and programs that directly impact employee experience and engagement. What You’ll Do Onboarding Help Hiring Managers prepare and issue employment offers, contracts, and welcome documents. Ensure state-specific employment compliance and registrations are completed. Coordinate onboarding planning: company policies, benefits overview, team introductions, role-specific training schedules, and buddy assignments. Set up new employee accounts in HR and payroll systems. Coordinate IT and office access (email, software, hardware, building access). Facilitate completion of mandatory compliance documents (e.g., right-to-work, tax forms). Track onboarding checklists and act as the main point of contact for new hires during their first weeks. Offboarding Coordinate voluntary and involuntary exits in HR systems and payroll platforms. Ensure collection of company property (laptops, badges, etc.) and terminate system access. Facilitate exit interviews and maintain confidential records, including separation agreements. Process final payroll, accrued PTO, and benefits terminations in compliance with laws and policies. Payroll Coordination Track deadlines for semi-monthly and bi-weekly payroll submissions, including PTO and allowances approvals. Liaise with external payroll providers to resolve queries and ensure accuracy. Support benefits enrollment, respond to employee queries, and manage changes during open enrollment or qualifying events. Maintain accurate payroll and benefits records across all platforms. Assist leadership and finance with payroll reporting. People Operations Support recruitment coordination: approvals, job postings, scheduling interviews, and candidate communication. Maintain and improve People Operations processes and templates for consistency across locations. Handle confidential information with discretion and escalate issues to HR leadership when needed. Support employee wellbeing initiatives, surveys, feedback collection, and engagement events. Office & Operations Coordination Act as a point of contact for office supplies, and general coordination. Assist with team events, onboarding sessions, and company-wide meetings. Support health, safety, and facilities administration for local offices. What We’re Looking For Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Management, or related field preferred. 3+ years’ experience in HR administration, people operations, or office coordination. Familiarity with HRIS or people systems (e.g., BambooHR) and basic payroll understanding. Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple priorities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. High level of discretion handling confidential information. Proactive, adaptable, and able to work effectively across time zones and departments. Why Join Us Be a key part of a growing, international company with opportunities to expand your career. Work closely with a collaborative, supportive team that values people and culture. Gain exposure to all aspects of HR, payroll, and operations across multiple regions. Help shape processes and programs that directly impact employee experience and engagement. Next Steps Click on the button to start your journey and join the Infravision team today. Find out more about Infravision If you'd like to delve deeper into the world of Infravision, we invite you to stay connected with our latest updates, news, and insights by following our social media channels and visiting our website https://infravision.com.au/. Diversity and inclusion At Infravision, diversity and inclusion are integral to our culture. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, fostering an inclusive environment where unique perspectives are valued. Our competitive compensation package, including Employee Share Options, reflects our commitment to recognising and rewarding talent. We support flexible work arrangements for a harmonious work-life balance. Infravision is a proud veteran employer, with up to 40% of our workforce being from former armed forces backgrounds. title: Director of People Operations
description: Director of People Operations Location:Minneapolis, MN FLSA Status:Exempt Job Status:Full Time Work Model:Hybrid Work Schedule:Monday–Friday with occasional evenings and/or weekends Vehicle Required:No Amount of Travel Required:Occasional domestic travel Positions Supervised:People Operations Generalist Reports To:VP of Operations Department:People Operations Reema Health is both a social care and behavioral health provider. We believe that a personalized, community-based approach to care makes it easier for anyone to access the things they need to make their lives better. We know that life’s challenges often exist because the systems built to help are a burden to navigate. We believe building a relationship with a real person — someone who listens, meets our members where they are, and understands the community — can ease those burdens and effectively connect members to health care. We're a passionate, member-focused tech startup, and we're on the lookout for a talented and empathetic Director of People Operations. The Director of People Operations is responsible for building and managing our HR infrastructure, compliance and operational systems. This is a hands-on role that will initially focus on transitioning the company from our current PEO to direct employment operations across 10+ states in healthcare. You will own benefits administration, compliance, payroll systems, HR technology, employee data management while partnering closely with our Director of Talent who leads recruitment, onboarding, performance management, and learning and development. The ideal candidate brings extensive experience in HR operations with a proven track record of PEO transitions, multi-state compliance management, and building scalable HR systems in fast-paced, high-growth environments. This role will start as a tactical operator building our infrastructure with significant hands-on execution required, and has potential to grow as the company scales. Responsibilities: PEO Transition & HR Infrastructure Lead the end-to-end transition from our current PEO to direct employment, including vendor selection, system implementation, data migration, benefits transition, and compliance across all states. Select, implement and optimize HRIS, payroll, benefits administration, and time-tracking systems to support our distributed workforce. Establish payroll operations, ensuring accurate and compliant processing. Build and document HR policies, procedures and workflows to support scalable operations. Benefits & Total Rewards Design, implement, and manage a competitive and equitable total rewards strategy, including compensation structures, benefits programs, wellness initiatives and leave programs. Manage open enrollment and benefits communications. Partner with benefits brokers and carriers to negotiate rates and ensure excellent employee experience. Compliance & Risk Management Ensure all people operations policies and practices are in full compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws. Proactively stay ahead of new regulations and adjust policies as needed. Identify and mitigate people-related risks, including those related to employment practices, safety, and compliance. Conduct effective, thorough, and objective investigations. HR Operations & Employee Experience Oversee compensation structures, job architecture, and equity in pay practices. Drive the strategy for employee celebrations, recognition incentives, and engagement in a remote workforce, ensuring every team member feels valued and connected. Use people analytics and HR data to inform decisions and measure the impact of people initiatives. Serve as a key partner to leaders across all business units, championing the company's core values and ensuring they are woven into all people-related programs, policies, and initiatives. Foster a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement across the People Operations team. Education, Experience and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; a master's degree or relevant certification (e.g., SPHR, SHRM-SCP) is a plus. Minimum 10 years of progressive HR operations experience in a fast-paced, innovative environment. Experience working in a high-growth startup or healthcare is a plus. Proven experience leading PEO transitions and implementing HR infrastructure, including HRIS selection and benefits program design. Minimum 5 years of experience in people leadership with a demonstrated history motivating and managing a team of HR professionals. Experience leading teams in Healthcare or Health Tech is a plus. Exceptional leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence and build strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels. Deep experience in multi-state employment compliance, including designing and managing compensation and benefits programs. In-depth knowledge of wage and hour regulations, including the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA), to ensure proper classification of employees and accurate payroll practices. Comprehensive understanding of benefits administration and compliance, including laws related to the Affordable Care Act (ACA), Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act (COBRA), Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA), and other regulations governing health and welfare plans. Demonstrated understanding of laws prohibiting discrimination and governing employee leave, such as the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) laws, Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), and various state-specific leave requirements. A strong background in identifying and mitigating HR-related risks, developing sound policies, and implementing best practices to ensure a safe, ethical, and compliant workplace. Demonstrated history building and iterating operational programs, policies, and practices that scale with organizational growth. High EQ with heightened self-awareness and executive presence and ability to operate in ambiguous environments. Benefits: Competitive Salary and Equity Package Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance HSA and FSA Options 401(k) Retirement Savings with Company Match Employee Assistance Program Paid Parental Leave Accrued Paid Time Off Technology Stipend Flexible Schedules and Remote Work As an equal opportunity employer, Reema Health is committed to a diverse workforce. Employment decisions regarding recruitment and selection will be made without discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, genetic information or characteristic, gender identity and expression, veteran status, or other non-job-related characteristics or other prohibited grounds specified in applicable federal, state and local laws. Reema Health has reviewed this job description to ensure that essential functions and basic responsibilities have been included. It is intended to provide guidelines for job expectations and assess the prospective employee and/or current employees ability to perform the position described. It is not intended to be interpreted as an exhaustive list of all functions, responsibilities, skills, and abilities for this role. Additional functions and requirements may be assigned by supervisors as deemed appropriate. title: Director of People Operations
description: Reports to:Chief of Staff Classification:Full-time, permanent FLSA Status:Exempt Pay Type:Salaried Job Summary:The Director of People Operations serves as a strategic leader for Saxbys' human capital initiatives. This role drives the development and implementation of comprehensive people strategies that align with Saxbys Mission and Core Values while ensuring operational excellence across Saxbys' current and projected footprint. This role oversees all aspects of the team member lifecycle, from onboarding to offboarding, while ensuring policies and practices create an engaging, compliant, and values-driven workplace culture and support our growth in both cafe operations and higher education partnerships. What You Will Own People Strategy:Develop and implement comprehensive people strategies that support Saxbys' business objectives, culture, and growth plans in partnership with the Executive team. Translate organizational goals into actionable people initiatives that drive engagement, retention, and performance. Compliance & Policy Development:Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations across Saxbys' footprint. Stay current on legislative changes and implement policies and procedures to maintain compliance while supporting operational needs. Performance Management:Design and oversee performance management systems that align with Saxbys' values and business objectives, ensuring fair and consistent evaluation processes across the organization. Implement frameworks that identify, develop, and retain top talent throughout the organization. People Operations:Lead the People Operations team in delivering excellent service in onboarding, offboarding, benefits administration, team member relations, and systems management. Create and maintain scalable processes that foster positive team member relations, addressing concerns promptly and effectively while promoting a culture of open communication and trust. Culture & Engagement:Lead initiatives that strengthen company culture, improve team member satisfaction, and increase engagement, ensuring Saxbys' values are lived throughout the organization. Analyze survey data to identify trends and opportunities, and partner with leadership to implement action plans. Who You Will Support Executive Team:Serve as a strategic partner to the Executive team, providing guidance on people-related matters and their impact on business objectives. Deliver insights on workforce trends, compliance risks, and talent strategies. Department Leaders:Partner with leaders across the organization to understand their people needs and develop solutions that support their objectives. Provide coaching and guidance on managing team performance and development. Team Members:Create accessible channels for support, guidance, and resources that enhance the team member experience from onboarding through career development. Academic Partners:Serve as the in-house expert on student team member matters, partnering with the Growth & Strategy team on university relations. Act as a liaison with higher education partners on issues related to academic credit, compensation, and compliance requirements for the Experiential Learning Platform. Who You Will Supervise This position will supervise the People Operations team, including the Generalist and Coordinator, with potential for team growth as the organization expands. What Success Looks Like Engagement Index for both HQ and Cafe remains above 80 100% compliance with employment laws and regulations Reduce annual turnover by 15% through improved retention strategies Implement scalable HR systems that support company growth while maintaining operational efficiency Successful implementation of performance management processes that align with company values Where You Excel Strategic People Leadership Conflict Resolution Compliance Expert Systems & Technology Implementation Master of Prioritization Developer of Talent Change Management Relationship Building Data-Informed Decision Making What You Have Done 5+ years of progressive experience in human resources or people operations 2+ years of experience supervising and developing a team Experience managing HR functions across multiple states in retail, food service, or hospitality industries Demonstrated success in building and scaling HR functions in growing organizations Experience with HRIS implementation and optimization Demonstrated experience navigating complex team member relations issues Proven track record of developing policies that support organizational culture Experience working in fast-paced, growth-oriented environments Experience working with higher education institutions or programs a plus What is Required Support, exhibit, and promote Saxbys Mission and Core Values in all daily activities. We allow brands and agencies to collaborate with millions of social media creators and execute comprehensive influencer marketing campaigns. Since its launch in October 2016, Upfluence has yielded a monthly double-digit growth rate, and we are therefore seeking further expansion for our team and offices. Our rapidly growing global team is currently distributed between our offices in NYC, Los Angeles, Mexico City, and Lyon. We’re seeking an experienced, strategic, and people-centered Director of People Operations to lead our People function in the U.S. and support our global HR strategy. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced, dynamic environments and is passionate about scaling culture, optimizing operations, and empowering employees across multiple hubs. Oversee and enhance all aspects of the employee lifecycle, from recruitment to offboarding. Drive HR strategy aligned with business goals, partnering closely with leadership across global hubs. Manage compliance with U.S. employment laws and coordinate with international HR counterparts in France and Mexico. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. title: People Operations Manager
description: Dealpath is looking for a self-motivated People Operations Manager to join our growing team in San Francisco or New York! The People Operations Manager will own the HR operations function, building an inclusive, scalable, best-in-class employee experience that centers efficiency, compliance, and equity. This role offers the opportunity to directly shape how we support and scale our people as Dealpath continues its growth trajectory. Be a key builder of the People Operations function at a scaling SaaS company. Lead the design and execution of HR programs that directly impact employee engagement, performance, and culture. Partner with leaders across the company to ensure our people processes support growth and compliance across CA, NY, TX, and beyond. Have the opportunity to grow into a leadership role as our People function scales. As the People Operations Manager, you will: Manage HR operations end-to-end, ensuring compliance, accuracy, and efficiency across the employee lifecycle. Administer and optimize the HRIS (BambooHR) and maintain accurate employee files and HR data reporting. Lead onboarding and offboarding processes, coordinating across People Ops, IT, and hiring managers. Oversee benefits administration, annual renewals, and leaves of absence. Run engagement surveys and administer performance review cycles. Support employee relations matters with professionalism and discretion. Partner with leaders to deliver training and development programs for managers and employees. Maintain the employee handbook and ensure policies are compliant with federal, state, and local employment laws. Manage immigration cases in partnership with outside counsel. Track HR metrics and provide insights to leadership. Contribute to building scalable processes and mentor junior team members. Demonstrate commitment towards our company values and promote the day-to-day practices associated with building a stronger company culture. Create and implement manager and employee training programs that foster learning and development across Dealpath. Input compensation changes and partner with accounting on payroll. We’re excited that you have: A proven ability to resolve a wide range of issues and apply judgment in complex situations. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to influence with data-driven insights. A personable, professional, and proactive “get it done” attitude. Excitement towards building scalable HR programs and implementing HR best-practices. Experience working at high growth, fast paced companies. A high level of integrity, discretion, and sound judgment. 7+ years of experience in People Operations/HR, ideally in a fast-paced, high-growth company. PHR, SPHR, or SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP certification. Strong knowledge of California and/or New York employment law. Experience with BambooHR, 15Five, Culture Amp Google Apps, or similar tools. Proficiency with data analysis. Perks & Culture: Medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage options Flexible Spending Account Paid Parental Leave 401(k) Company sponsored commuter benefits Flexible time off policy Hybrid 3 days in office requirement Catered lunches and snacks Monthly wellness reimbursement. The estimated base compensation range for candidates is $128,000 - $165,000. This position is also eligible for Dealpath's equity plan. Your compensation will be based upon several factors including your experience, qualifications, education, location, and the skills assessed in Dealpath's interview process. Your actual compensation will be confirmed in writing at the time of offer. Dealpath's compensation ranges are determined by current market data, so compensation data posted on our job posts may change as new market data becomes available. About Dealpath: Dealpath is the world’s largest and most trusted real estate investment management platform. To date, Dealpath has powered over $10 trillion in transactions in partnership with hundreds of firms, from leading global institutions including Blackstone, Nuveen, LaSalle, CBRE IM, and MetLife to lean mid-market and regional organizations. Dealpath drives investment performance by uniting data, insights, and execution in a platform purpose-built for real estate, giving firms the tools they need to operate with speed and precision and unlock opportunity in a dynamic and competitive landscape where information reigns supreme. Our company is led by an experienced team and backed by a combination of top tier venture capital firms and strategic industry partners including: Blackstone, Nasdaq, 8VC, JLL Spark, WTI, GreenSoil Investments, LeFrak, Milstein, Bechtel, and Morgan Stanley Expansion Capital. We value your voice! If you get excited about solving real business challenges and working closely with other smart folks in a winning culture - we’d love to meet you! title: People Operations Partner
description: Hypori Inc., a leading provider of SaaS cybersecurity solutions, is a disruptive technology company transforming secure mobility for government and commercial customers. Hypori’s secure virtual workspace enables users to access critical data and apps from any mobile device without compromising user privacy. Learn more at https://hypori.com. Overview:The People Operations Partner will play a critical role in delivering a seamless employee experience and scaling Hypori’s People function. Reporting to the Head of People, this role will manage talent acquisition, onboarding, benefits administration, compliance, and people analytics. The People Operations Partner will ensure processes run smoothly and consistently through strong execution, attention to detail, and clear communication, serving as a trusted resource for employees and managers. Based in Austin, TX, the role follows a hybrid schedule and will provide regular in-person support at the Austin office, representing the People team during key company moments and employee needs. The People Operations Partner will also serve as deputy to the Head of People, taking on responsibilities as needed, including employee relations, separations, and other sensitive matters. Responsibilities: Benefits & Compensation Management:Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks, while responding to employee inquiries. Monitor industry trends to help maintain competitive offerings and provide compensation data support to the Head of People and Finance. Lead annual compensation planning by leveraging Pave and other benchmarking tools to guide salary planning, role leveling, and equitable pay practices. People Operations & Compliance:Implement and document People policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with employment laws and company standards. Support payroll alignment, vendor coordination, and compliance-related reporting. People Analytics & Reporting:Compile and analyze people-related data to prepare regular reports on key metrics such as turnover, time-to-fill, diversity, and engagement. Provide insights that support workforce planning and continuous improvement across the People function. Employee Engagement & Culture:Contribute to a positive company culture by supporting engagement initiatives, events, and recognition programs. Serve as a trusted resource for employees, providing clear guidance on People policies and escalating complex issues as needed. Talent Acquisition & Onboarding:Lead end-to-end full-cycle recruitment efforts, including sourcing, screening, and coordinating interviews, while building and maintaining talent pipelines. Manage relationships with hiring managers and external partners. Build, manage, and continuously improve onboarding plans and activities to ensure new hires have a seamless, consistent, and engaging integration experience. Representation of the People Team:Provide in-person People support in the Austin office during key company events and moments that benefit from on-site presence (e.g., Town Halls, QBRs, milestone celebrations, or terminations held in the office). Deputy to the Head of People:Fill in as needed to support the Head of People, taking on responsibilities aligned with the role, including employee relations, terminations, and other sensitive matters. Qualifications: People/HR Experience:3–5 years of progressive experience in People Operations, People/HR, or a related role, with responsibility for recruiting, onboarding, benefits administration, compliance, and People/HR systems. Technical Skills:Proficiency with HRIS platforms (e.g., BambooHR, Lattice, Greenhouse, or similar) and strong data analysis skills using Excel or other tools. Analytics & Compensation:Familiarity with people analytics and compensation processes, including exposure to benchmarking or tools like Pave. Knowledge & Communication:Strong understanding of employment laws and People/HR best practices, with excellent written and verbal communication skills to clearly explain policies and processes. Execution & Organization:Highly organized, detail-oriented, and process-driven, able to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a lean People/HR team. Professionalism & Partnership:Ability to handle sensitive employee matters with empathy and discretion while building trust and credibility with employees and managers. Preferred Attributes: Industry Experience:Background in a high-growth or technology environment, with the ability to adapt People/HR programs as the company scales. Culture-Building:Experience contributing to employee engagement or recognition initiatives. Growth Orientation:Interest in developing broader People leadership skills and stepping into greater responsibility over time. Pay Range: $100,000 - $115,000 USD About Us Hypori Inc. provides a generous benefits package for full-time employees that includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, parental leave, and life and disability packages. We also invest in our employees' futures by providing a 401(k) plan with employer-matching contributions that vest starting from your first day of employment.In addition to the base compensation, Hypori also offer a performance bonus, which is primarily contingent upon company-wide performance.We are dedicated to investing in the tools and skills required to be strong, collaborative colleagues and people managers to help build and retain a strong workforce. Hypori is an Equal Employment and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. At Hypori, we are committed to creating and promoting an inclusive workplace that embraces differences and perspectives – making us a stronger, more successful company. In doing so, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities where appropriate. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should contact people@hypori.com for assistance. #Hypori #BI-Remote #LI-Remote The number of jobs in each salary range for all: Government Virtual Assistant Amazon Warehouse Data Entry Warehouse Post Office Cyber Security Customer Service Construction Data Analyst Work From Home Remote Online Part Time Entry Level Freelance Weekend Summer Full Time Seasonal Amazon jobs UPS jobs Walmart jobs Starbucks jobs Target jobs Costco jobs FedEx jobs Apple jobs Walgreens jobs Home Depot jobs New York City Atlanta Denver Dallas Orlando Chicago Nashville San Antonio Tucson Las Vegas Browse jobs Blog ValueMyResume ApplyIQ AI Tools Post a job API About Careers Contact Privacy Terms & Conditions USAchange

title: People Operations Specialist
description: Do you have experience in recruitment? Are you looking for an opportunity to work for a non-profiit, mission-based organization that helps individuals in need? If so, consider joining our Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health Team as a Recruitment Coordinator, a rewarding experience that will give you a great sense of personal achievement! Being a People Operations Specialist has its Advantages You will work with other dedicated professionals who share your passion in People Operations. We offer: A wealth of resources and connection opportunities with our national network of People Operations professionals Opportunities to learn and grow professionally Over 5 weeks of paid time off your first year. Quality Low-Cost Benefits, plus student loan debt assistance and 30-day benefit eligibility waiting period for new hires! https://www.mydevereuxbenefits.org/ Access to the Savi Student Loan Checkup tool to help you navigate the student loan system – quickly see your repayment plan options and discover potential savings! A rewarding career while making a difference! Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health New York provides programs and services for children and adults with intellectual disabilities, Autism Spectrum Disorder, and dual diagnoses. As a People Operations Specialist based out of Red Hook, NY (upper Dutchess County), you will: Provide recruitment support and candidate management (managing the organization's ATS (iCIMS), coordinating and scheduling interviews, drafting and sending candidate communications, posting job requisitions, screening resumes, assisting with recruitment events, etc.) Coordinate pre-employment and onboarding (scheduling and tracking pre-employment appointments, administering drug screens, collecting and verifying references, submitting required background checks, monitoring pending results, preparing files, ensuring documents are complete and accurate, assisting with orientation setup, etc.) Ensure compliance and recordkeeping (maintaining compliance tracking logs for all pre-employment and onboarding activities, partnering with Manager to ensure staff meet requirements, conducting periodic audits of files, handling confidential information in accordance with HIPAA and organizational policy, etc.) Provide People Operations support (assisting with HRIS entry, collaborating with the team to ensure smooth hiring and onboarding experiences, providing exceptional customer service, special projects as assigned, etc.) Salary:(commensurate with education and experience) With HS diploma: $22.50 - $24.07 per hour With Bachelors: $23.50 - $25.14 per hour With Masters: $24.50 - $26.21 per hour You deserve to work somewhere that gives back to you! Devereux is proud to offerASCEND – the first career accelerator programexclusively designed to give behavioral healthcare workers – the career guidance, one-on-one coaching, skills and financial assistance you need to reach your full potential. This program includes tuition assistance and student loan repayment, among other benefits! #sponsored Education & Experience Associate’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field required; Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum of 2 years of experience in human resources, onboarding, or people operations; nonprofit or healthcare experience strongly preferred. Familiarity with state and federal background clearance processes (e.g., OPWDD, Justice Center, NYSED) a plus. Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and HRIS systems (e.g., Oracle, Kronos, ICIMS). Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information appropriately. Strong organizational and time management skills. Commitment to the mission of supporting individuals with autism and developmental disabilities. Devereux has a zero-tolerance policy for abuse and maintains policies and procedures to systematically reduce the risk of abuse to occur in our organization. Devereux fosters a culture of reporting abuse, and will cooperate with the authorities to the fullest extent possible. Company Overview Devereux is one of the nation’s largest nonprofit organizations, providing services, insight and leadership in the evolving field of behavioral healthcare. Founded in 1912, Devereux operates a comprehensive national network of clinical, therapeutic, educational and employment programs that positively impact the lives of 10,000+ children, adults – and their families – every year. Our Mission:Devereux changes lives – by unlocking and nurturing human potential for people living with emotional, behavioral or cognitive differences. With nearly 6,500 employees working in programs across the country, Devereux is a trusted partner for families, schools and communities, serving individuals in the areas of autism, intellectual and developmental disabilities, specialty mental health, education and foster care. Our Culture, Our Expectations At Devereux, Servant Leadership is embedded throughout our culture and every aspect of our organizational framework. Our mission-driven, people-first mindset is at the heart of the compassionate and high-quality programming we provide – every day – for the individuals and families we serve, and other key stakeholders. Devereux offers challenging and exciting work, and our team environment creates an empowering, positive and rewarding atmosphere. To be successful at Devereux, you will: put the needs of others first, feel called to serve and called to lead. As a member of our team, you will be a significant part of our commitment to providing a welcoming and supportive work environment across all programs and services, and within all policies and employee practices. We believe a workplace rooted in inclusivity – offering a sense of belonging to all those who walk through our doors – is fundamental to delivering the highest quality healthcare services. Through open dialogue and the creation of brave spaces, we will engage in work that gives each of us a chance to change the world – one person, one family, one community at a time. What Devereux Offers You In addition to a competitive salary, Devereux provides a comprehensive health and welfare program to eligible full-time employees, family members and domestic partners. Eligible employees are eligible to start benefits after30 daysof employment. In addition, we offer; Medical (including telemedicine via phone, web, app), dental, prescription drug, preventative care, and mental health services. Student loan debt assistance, tuition reimbursement and continuing education assistance. Generous time-off (start accruing 1st day), 403(b) retirement plan with matching benefit, and voluntary/employee paid supplemental life and accident coverage. Employee assistance / work-life balance program. Visit www.mydevereuxbenefits.org to see why Devereux is a great place to work! Devereux is a drug-free workplace, drug screening required. title: Head of People Operations
description: About Urban Sky: Urban Sky is a venture-backed aerospace startup that pioneers utilization of the stratosphere and reimagines the way humans view and analyze the earth. We design, build, operate, and sell stratospheric balloon systems, and the data we collect supports a wide range of applications, from real-time wildfire monitoring to urban mapping. Our technology is also employed by government customers including the Department of Defense (DoD), NASA, and others. Urban Sky sends flight vehicles to the stratosphere on a weekly basis. Our team consists of engineers, makers, developers, and doers who believe in the power of human potential when passion meets utility within a small, supportive team. At Urban Sky we strive to create a team culture grounded in candor, inclusion, respect and empowerment. We aim to build the next chapter of stratospheric history in Denver and are seeking self-starting, open-minded, and hard-working team members. About The Role: Urban Sky is seeking aHead of People Operationsto build and lead our People Operations department in Denver, CO. As a key member of the leadership team, you will architect and own the full employee experience—from recruiting and onboarding through engagement, performance, and offboarding. Inspired by Google’s data-driven People Operations philosophy, this leader will build systems and processes that elevate organizational performance, foster a culture of empowerment, and drive strategic people outcomes tied directly to business growth. This role requires a leader who is bothtechnically fluent and operationally driven—someone who can design and deploy systems as rigorously as an engineer, while embodying the human-centered, data-backed approach. You’ll experiment, measure, and iterate to create people programs that are innovative, evidence-based, and deeply aligned with our mission. The ideal candidate combines empathy with analytics, systems thinking with tactical execution, and a passion for building an environment where people thrive and the organization performs at its best. You will report directly to the Co-founder/CEO and will be responsible for transforming Urban Sky’s people function into a data-informed, technically capable, and tactically excellent department that scales with the company’s growth. Key Responsibilities: Organizational Design & StrategyBuild the People Operations function from the ground up, including frameworks for recruiting, onboarding, growth, performance, and offboarding.Partner with leadership to align people strategies with company objectives and operational goals.Establish data-driven systems to measure engagement, performance, retention, and hiring efficiency.Develop scalable programs for leadership development, training, and learning rooted in analytics and experimentation. Build the People Operations function from the ground up, including frameworks for recruiting, onboarding, growth, performance, and offboarding. Partner with leadership to align people strategies with company objectives and operational goals. Establish data-driven systems to measure engagement, performance, retention, and hiring efficiency. Develop scalable programs for leadership development, training, and learning rooted in analytics and experimentation. Talent Acquisition & Employer BrandingDesign and execute a talent strategy that attracts top performers across engineering, operations, and business teams.Champion hiring standards that emphasize mission alignment, intellectual humility, and growth potential.Equip all team members to serve as active recruiters and cultural ambassadors. Champion hiring standards that emphasize mission alignment, intellectual humility, and growth potential. Equip all team members to serve as active recruiters and cultural ambassadors. Culture & EngagementShape and sustain our culture.Create mechanisms for continuous feedback, open dialogue, and peer-driven improvement.Leverage surveys, pulse data, and analytics to identify and act on engagement opportunities. Shape and sustain our culture. Create mechanisms for continuous feedback, open dialogue, and peer-driven improvement. Leverage surveys, pulse data, and analytics to identify and act on engagement opportunities. Establish clear, fair, and inspiring performance management processes focused on personal growth over ratings. Develop total rewards frameworks that balance fairness, recognition, and high-performance incentives. Partner with finance to manage compensation strategies. Implement calibration processes and feedback loops to ensure objectivity and consistency in evaluation. Lead all employee performance review processes. Create and manage HR policies, systems, and compliance processes in alignment with employment law and Urban Sky contracts (including DoD and government contracts and associated requirements). Administer benefits and payroll (for both exempt and non-exempt employees). On-board and off-board employees as required, in full compliance with company policies, procedures and applicable laws. Handle internal employee relations, serve as a trusted advisor and confidant to all team members, and lead conflict resolution and investigations, if required. Lead full-cycle recruitment: sourcing, screening, interviewing, and hiring for all departments, working closely with Hiring Managers internally to ensure a smooth, timely process for all parties involved. Support leadership in bonus, commission, and equity plan administration. Benchmark compensation and develop salary structures to maintain internal equity and market competitiveness. Lead HR technology and data initiatives for tracking, reporting, and forecasting people metrics. Ensure confidentiality, accuracy, and efficiency in all employee documentation and data handling. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Organizational Psychology, Business Administration, or related field. 7+ years of progressive experience in people operations, HR, or organizational leadership roles, with at least 3 years in a management capacity. Proven success designing or scaling people systems in a startup or fast-growth environment. Strong analytical mindset and experience using data to inform decisions. title: People Operations Intern
description: Assist with the hiring process for seasonal hires Send and receive applicant and employee communications, including offer letters and onboarding documents Process pre-employment drug screenings and background checks Complete Form I-9 verifications via E-Verify, and upload documents to new hire profiles and update systems Purchase and send employee gifts Facilitate system password reset for employees Provide support during gameday functions Process employment verification requests Assist with employee food options, including victory treats during the playing season Assist with the ordering of various supplies related to hiring and employee support Accurately enter updates into the HRIS (Dayforce), workflow management systems, and tracking spreadsheets Provide administrative support filing, scanning, copying, inventory management, and expense management Assist with other duties and projects to support the department and the business Must be currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree OR have graduated within 18 months of the internship start date Must be available to work in the office 40 hours per week, flexing hours where appropriate for game weeks Ability to continually act with integrity and handle sensitive situations and data with utmost confidentiality and professionalism Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite and ability to easily learn other software systems Positive team player with ability to be flexible and open to new tasks Strong interest and passion for human resources, people operations, and employee engagement Excellent communications skills (verbal and written) Prior human resources or employee support experience Degree focus in human resources Term: April 2026 – October 2026 (flexible) Interns will give a final presentation at the end of their internship. title: Director, People Operations
description: Grow with us... Life at Starwood Hotels is based on a simple idea: the world is beautiful and we want to keep it that way. But we can’t do it alone. That’s why hiring thoughtful and inspiring Team Members and Leaders who understand that our people, collaboration, stellar service, and respect for nature are so important to us. About Us: 1 Hotels is mission-driven and a platform for change, celebrating nature in every decision we make. From how guests arrive to how they sleep, eat, relax, interact, and depart, our commitment to sustainability, innovative design, and a harmonious connection with nature is unwavering. 1 HOTELS IS... Natural.Nature guides everything we do. Modern.Of the time, with an eye on the past and a foot in the future. Conscious.Mindful of how our hotels are created and how our guests are treated. Discovery.Explorations of surrounding locales. Imperfect.Still evolving — we don’t have all the answers. Committed.Bettering ourselves and bettering the industry. 1 Hotelsinvites guests to live in rhythm with nature—offering spaces that restore, inspire, and come alive from day to night, where sustainability, wellness, and social energy exist in thoughtful balance. Position Overview... The role of Director of People Operations is the key to a high-performance culture that emphasizes our brand mission and point of view, as well as upholds ambitious standards for every team member, sets them up to attain challenging goals and evolves the workforce and culture through ongoing development and ever-evolving needs of the hotel. One more thing: we believe in positive, healthy work environments, no matter what. It’ll be your job to foster one that’s constantly evolving—improving every employee’s work life and giving them a life outside work. Requirements for Success... Minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Human Resources or Business. Experience in luxury hotels as Assistant Director of People operations or Director for a minimum of five years Experience working with Workday is a plus. Active affiliation with appropriate Human Resources networks and organizations and ongoing community involvement preferred. Broad knowledge and experience in employment law, compensation, organizational planning, organization development, employee relations, safety, and training and development. Strong oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal and coaching skills. Strong organizational skills. About us... As a mission-driven company, our purpose is our true north, and our compass guides the way. The purpose we live by impacts the lives of our team members, drives the experiences for our guests, builds community with like-minded travelers and takes care of the planet we live in. Founded in 2006 by Barry Sternlicht, Starwood Hotels is a luxury hotel brand management company and affiliate of global private investment firm Starwood Capital Group. Starwood Hotels is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in a diverse, sustainable workforce with an empowered, inclusive culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis covered under applicable law. If you require any special accommodations, please visit People Operations.
