title: People Operations Specialist
description: xAI’s mission is to create AI systems that can accurately understand the universe and aid humanity in its pursuit of knowledge. Our team is small, highly motivated, and focused on engineering excellence. This organization is for individuals who appreciate challenging themselves and thrive on curiosity. We operate with a flat organizational structure. All employees are expected to be hands-on and to contribute directly to the company’s mission. Leadership is given to those who show initiative and consistently deliver excellence. Work ethic and strong prioritization skills are important. All engineers are expected to have strong communication skills. They should be able to concisely and accurately share knowledge with their teammates. We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented People Operations Specialist to join our global People Operations team. In this role, you will play a critical part in delivering seamless support to employees and stakeholders across EMEA, APAC, and the Americas, ensuring an exceptional employee experience. You will handle sensitive employee information with the utmost confidentiality and integrity, focusing on data accuracy and process efficiency. The ideal candidate is a proactive team player with a client-service mindset, a passion for continuous improvement, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment. Generate and manage HR documentation, including offer letters, contracts, and other employee-related materials with precision and efficiency. Oversee new hire onboarding processes, including HRIS audits, coordinating background checks, and collaborating with IT for laptop delivery. Support employee job changes, such as promotions, salary adjustments, and international transfers, ensuring smooth transitions. Manage the off-boarding process, maintaining compliance and data integrity throughout. Create, maintain, and audit employee files to ensure accurate and up-to-date records. Leverage technology to streamline HR processes and enhance operational efficiency wherever possible. Serve as the first point of contact for employee inquiries on HR topics, providing timely and professional responses. Identify and recommend opportunities for continuous process improvement to enhance the employee experience. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. 1+ years of experience in an HR administration, operations, or generalist role, with a strong preference for experience in the technology industry. Exceptional organizational skills with a proven ability to prioritize tasks and maintain confidentiality when handling sensitive information. Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data integrity and process accuracy. Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a collaborative global team. Experience with HRIS platforms and leveraging technology to improve HR processes. A client-service mindset with a passion for going above and beyond to support employees. Strong problem-solving skills and enthusiasm for identifying and implementing process improvements. High energy and adaptability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment. A sense of adventure and humor to navigate challenges with a positive mindset. $72,000 - $95,000 USD Base salary is just one part of our total rewards package at xAI, which also includes equity, comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short & long-term disability insurance, life insurance, and various other discounts and perks. xAI is an equal opportunity employer. title: People Operations Manager
description: At CloudFit Software, we’re reimagining how companies support their people by blending HR, employee experience, and operational excellence—and we’re looking for a People Operations Manager to be the on-site People champion at our Lynchburg office. In this fast-paced role, you’ll lead onboarding, drive employee engagement, and manage daily operations while partnering with stakeholders across a fast-moving environment. You’ll be the go-to resource for all People-related needs, building strong relationships and shaping a positive, people-first culture with empathy, adaptability, and professionalism.Responsibilities: Serve as the on-site ambassador for People Operations and Employee Experience Lead and deliver a dynamic New Employee Orientation experience, ensuring every new hire feels welcomed, informed, and connected from Day 1 (including HRIS entry, on-site setup, welcome materials, and orientation facilitation) Deliver and reinforce People policies, programs, and procedures to employees and managers Partner with remote People Ops team to flag employee concerns, policy risks, or cultural challenges Partner with Chief of Staff and VP of People Ops to support sensitive conversations and performance processes Coordinate ADA accommodations, policy exceptions, and documentation support Help monitor compliance with labor policies and escalate when needed Coordinate candidate scheduling, interviews, and ensure a positive experience Ensure on-site readiness for new hires and internal mobility transitions Build relationships with local colleges and universities to support recruiting efforts Coordinate and attend career fairs, campus visits, and community hiring events Support internship program coordination, including outreach, onboarding, and engagement 5-8 years of experience in HR, People Operations, or employee experience roles Strong verbal communication and interpersonal skills-you're comfortable delivering messages to employees and managers alike Ability to navigate competing priorities and personalities with professionalism A high degree of emotional intelligence, discretion, and resilience Comfort working closely with senior leaders and managing up effectively Strong organizational skills and the ability to execute autonomously in a fast-paced setting Experience supporting hybrid or distributed workforces Familiarity with ADA, FMLA, and performance documentation best practices Exposure to HRIS & ATS platforms (e.g., Namely, Rippling, Workday) Background in office coordination or workplace experience roles The salary range for this role is $70,000- $90,000 + benefits, & perks. Please note the national salary range listed in the job posting reflects the new hire salary range across levels and U.S. locations that would be applicable to the position. Final salary will be commensurate with the candidate’s final level and location. Also, the range represents salary only and does not include our total rewards package. Current Federal Security Clearance or ability to obtain (US Citizenship required) *CloudFit participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm you are authorized to work in the U.S. Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies show that women and people of color often hesitate to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification listed. At CloudFit, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification, we still encourage you to apply! You might be the perfect fit for this position—or another one on our team. CloudFit Benefits & Perks: CloudFit benefits are designed with wellness in mind, to support what matters the most: Physical Health: Medical, dental, vision insurance, & voluntary health options for you and your family! Mental Health: Talkspace, Calm, virtual therapy, counseling Financial Wellness: 401(k), HSA, FSAs, Personal Financial Advisors 3 Weeks of PTO, 15 Paid Company Holidays, 8 Giving Back Hours Wellness Program: reimbursement, gym discounts, health fairs, & more! Recognition Program: Earn & give recognition, annual awards, celebrations Career development for employees at every level is a priority at CloudFit. Certification Reimbursement User Friendly Career Development Tools & Resources Check out CloudFit Candidate Portal for more information on roles, benefits, internships, and more! About CloudFit CloudFit Software provides customers the ability to quickly iterate on the development of Cloud Solutions while optimizing security, networking, operations, and monitoring through an engineering mindset. At CloudFit, we instrument solutions that attempt to reduce the human element by applying automation and engineering to every aspect of a solution's lifecycle. CloudFit focuses on delivering managed scenarios that meet customer business needs. This allows us to provide core operational outcomes while integrating back with the customer’s existing operations teams. title: People Operations Intern
description: People Operation (Intern), US About Arango At Arango we're on a mission to make working with complex data simple, powerful, and AI-ready. Based in California and in Cologne (with a global team), we’re building a cutting-edge data platform that helps organizations bring all their data together — graph, document, key/value, full-text, and vector search — in one engine. Why does that matter? Because it means developers and data teams can build next-gen AI applications like RAG, knowledge graphs, and smart agents — without gluing together a bunch of tools that were never meant to work together. Our platform makes it easy to work with any kind of data-structured, semi-structured, or unstructured, and it gives teams everything they need to build faster, smarter, and with way more context. From our easy-to-learn AQL query language to modern integration tools, we’re here to help teams grow and scale with AI. Sounds exciting? We think so too. Come join us and help shape the future of data. Location: Austin, TX area. Note that occasional business travel will be required. Reports to: Global Director of Human Resources Compensation: $18 - $20/hour Work Hours: 20-30 hours/week Duration: 6 months with the possibility of extension We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented People Operation Intern to support our full team member lifecycle, from sourcing and hiring to comprehensive onboarding and offboarding. This role is essential for maintaining smooth administrative operations and ensuring a seamless experience for both candidates and the active team members. System Management: Responsible for adding, editing, and updating all personnel information for team members’ data in our HRIS/HR tools. Documentation: Prepare, issue, and track all standard documentation, including agreements and official employment letters, policies, etc. Offboarding: Execute the offboarding checklist, coordinating with IT and other departments. Onboarding: Assist the new hires with logistics and welcoming activities. Compliance: Initiate and track all required background checks using platforms following the jurisdiction of each country and state Interview Logistics: Manage the end-to-end scheduling of all interviews, acting as the primary point of contact for candidates and internal interview teams. Applicant Screening: Conduct initial screening of received applications. ATS Administration: Update email templates, interview guides, and scorecard templates. Manage user access and system configuration. Sourcing Support: Perform initial candidate sourcing and outreach. Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field. Prefers 1-2 years of experience in an HR or recruiting administrative role Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite or Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Slides). Experience or strong familiarity with HRIS/ATS platforms A proactive, can-do attitude with a willingness to learn quickly. Strong, professional communication skills in English (both written and spoken). The ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality and professionalism. Exceptional attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple priorities. Why Join Arango Our headquarters is in San Francisco (US) and we have an office in Cologne (Germany), but most of our diverse team works remotely worldwide. So, do you prefer your desk at home or do you want to join us at one of our locations? Your choice. The global minds of Arango come from 5 different continents and more than 20 countries. Diverse backgrounds enable us to see new solutions. We invite people from every culture, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, and of every age to apply to our positions. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications. Arango is committed to a workplace free of discrimination and harassment based on any of these characteristics. We love this diversity and encourage everyone curious and visionary to join the multi-model movement. title: People Operations Specialist
description: Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career. One of the key drivers to our success is a committed and rigorous emphasis on our people. We believe that our competitive advantage lies in our talent and that we can build a sustainable advantage by attracting, enabling and cultivating the world’s most exceptional people to do the very best work of their careers. Stripe is seeking aPeople Operations Specialistto join our Global People Support (GPS) team. This role is a critical pillar of GPS, focusing on complex operational challenges and continuous improvement across the employee lifecycle. You will serve as a critical operational stakeholder enabling HR transformation by ensuring seamless support, optimizing processes with data-driven insights, and collaborating closely with our Centers of Excellence (COEs). As a proactive, data-driven, and systems-oriented member of the GPS team, you will play a central role in maintaining an accurate HR operations infrastructure, facilitating critical employee lifecycle processes, and driving operational excellence to further delight our employees and partners. You will bridge operations and strategy, translating service insights into actionable improvements. Elevated Employee Support (Tier 2 Escalation):Provide a seamless and delightful support experience for Stripe employees and cross-functional partners, specifically handling complex inquiries and escalations routed from our Tier 1 Centralized Operations team or business partner teams, including bulk transaction processing, complex reorganization events, and separations. Process Optimization and Data-Driven Improvement: Bring innovative, data-driven ideas and recommend enhancements to existing HR processes and workflows. Interpret data (e.g., case volumes, resolution times) and formulate insights to proactively drive continuous operational improvements that enhance the overall employee experience. HR Transformation and Program Delivery:Serve as a key operational stakeholder and contributor to significant HR transformation initiatives, major system updates, and the delivery of critical, ongoing HR programs across the employee lifecycle (e.g., onboarding, global mobility, offboarding). Stakeholder and COE Partnership:Work closely with cross-functional teams and Centers of Excellence (COEs), including Compensation, Benefits, Employment Legal, and Employee Relations, to ensure operational needs are met, processes align, and smooth handoffs occur across the organization. HRIS Management and Integrity:Maintain the accuracy and integrity of our HR Information System (Workday) by accurately entering employee change transactions manually and through bulk data uploads, ensuring a robust and reliable foundation for all HR data. System Testing and Documentation:Participate in end-to-end, user acceptance, and other testing of new/existing processes or workflows. Create and update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) that document workflows from end to end, encompassing all system interactions and cross-functional handoffs for clarity and efficiency. Vendor Oversight:Assist with vendor oversight and management for operational services related to your areas of expertise, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and performance standards are maintained. Navigating Ambiguity:Operate effectively in ambiguous situations using your technical expertise, Stripe’s operating principles, and stakeholder perspectives to determine the best course of action and communicate clearly about systemic blockers. We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement. Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Operations, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in Human Resources or People Operations, with a focus on operational delivery. Knowledge of HR processes, policies, and best practices across the employee lifecycle. Technical aptitude and proficiency with Workday (specifically data accuracy and management) and experience with Salesforce or a similar ticketing system. Demonstrated problem-solving skills and the ability to handle complex Tier 2 escalations. Experience driving operational improvements and contributing to significant program delivery. Proven experience collaborating effectively with COEs (e.g., Legal, ER, People Partners) to resolve complex employee issues. Written and verbal English communication skills focused on providing customer service and distilling complex information. Collaboration skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally and cross-culturally in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Detail-oriented, with a focus on accuracy, quality, and compliance. Ability to navigate ambiguity effectively. Data fluency with the ability to interpret data and formulate insights to drive improvements and measure program success. Experience with knowledge management systems (e.g. Confluence). Vendor management experience. Strong organizational and project management skills. title: People Operations Manager
description: About Yondr Yondr is a disruptor. We challenge convention and simplify complexity.A global developer, owner operator and service provider of data centers, we deliver complex data center capacity needs for the world’s largest tech companies. Our exponential growth sees us looking for extraordinary people to help accelerate us towards our vision: a tomorrow without constraints. But we can’t do this without you. The role The People Operations Manager is a critical member of the People (HR) team, responsible for executing the People strategy in alignment with organizational objectives. Reporting to the Director People Operations, this role collaborates closely with leadership, senior managers, and employees to provide tactical HR support. This role will be responsible for regional benefits administration, managing onboarding and offboarding to ensure smooth transitions, overseeing payroll, and serve as a compliance partner to uphold labor laws and company policies. This role requires a proactive, data-driven approach to problem-solving and the ability to influence at all levels of the organization. This position is key to ensuring a positive employee experience while maintaining operational and regulatory excellence. Main responsibilities Payroll Inputs · Serve as the lead point of contact for payroll inputs, ensuring accurate and timely submission of all employee data (hires, terminations, promotions, compensation changes, overtime, leave, deductions) to payroll providers. · Validate payroll outputs by auditing data, reconciling discrepancies, and partnering with Finance and payroll vendors to ensure accuracy and compliance. · Maintain correct setup of employees in payroll systems to reflect state and local jurisdiction rules (tax codes, leave accruals, benefits eligibility). · Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll regulations across the U.S., including wage and hour laws, tax withholdings, garnishments, and reporting requirements. · Conduct regular audits to minimize errors, ensure timely filings, and mitigate compliance risks. Benefits Administration · Manage the full employee benefits lifecycle: enrollment, changes, terminations, renewals, and ongoing administration. · Serve as primary liaison with benefit providers, brokers, and vendors to ensure timely issue resolution and compliance with benefit regulations. · Administer benefits in compliance with federal and state laws (e.g., ACA, COBRA, ERISA, HIPAA, state leave programs). · Provide employees with clear, timely support and guidance on benefit plans, coverage, claims, and eligibility. · Conduct benefits audits to ensure accuracy, cost-effectiveness, and compliance. · Collaborate with Finance to reconcile benefits invoices and manage reporting requirements. Onboarding & Offboarding · Oversee end-to-end onboarding, ensuring accurate payroll/benefits setup and a positive employee experience. · Lead Day 1 orientation, introducing new hires to company culture, policies, benefits, & systems. · Manage offboarding processes, ensuring compliance with state-mandated timelines for final pay, benefits termination, and access removal. · Conduct exit interviews to gather feedback and identify trends for continuous improvement. · Partner with IT, Finance, and Workplace teams to ensure smooth operational transitions. Employee Relations · Act as a trusted partner to employees and managers in resolving workplace issues with fairness, confidentiality, and compliance in mind. · Provide coaching and guidance to managers on employee performance, conduct, and engagement matters. · Support investigations into employee concerns, ensuring alignment with company policies and legal standards. · Track ER cases to identify patterns, propose solutions, and strengthen the overall employee experience. Compliance · Ensure adherence to federal and state labor laws, regulations, and company policies. · Maintain proper state tax registrations, unemployment insurance accounts, and benefit compliance documentation. · Develop, update, and communicate HR policies in alignment with legal requirements and company standards. · Conduct compliance audits and provide guidance to managers on policy interpretation. HR Operations · Collaborate with COEs in compensation, benefits, and talent acquisition. · Analyze HR metrics to drive proactive workforce solutions. · Support additional People Team initiatives as needed. Qualifications and experience 6+ years of experience in an HR role, preferably within a fast-paced global organization.· Bachelor’s degree in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field.· Proven experience in HR within the Americas region, with strong knowledge of benefits administration, local labor laws.· Strong experience in benefits administration, including knowledge of federal and state benefit regulations (ACA, COBRA, ERISA, HIPAA).· Demonstrated ability to manage payroll and benefits vendor relationships.· Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.· Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders.· Critical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a results-driven approach. 6+ years of experience in an HR role, preferably within a fast-paced global organization. · Bachelor’s degree in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field. · Proven experience in HR within the Americas region, with strong knowledge of benefits administration, local labor laws. · Strong experience in benefits administration, including knowledge of federal and state benefit regulations (ACA, COBRA, ERISA, HIPAA). · Demonstrated ability to manage payroll and benefits vendor relationships. · Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively. · Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders. · Critical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a results-driven approach. title: People Operations Lead
description: Strategic Investment Group (Strategic), a pioneer in dedicated Outsourced Chief Investment Officer (OCIO) solutions since 1987, offers a comprehensive service platform for managing customized portfolios for a select group of clients. Strategic functions as our clients’ investment office partner and co-fiduciary, providing the highly specialized portfolio management that clients need to meet their investment goals. Our mission is to empower investors through experience, innovation, and excellence. Visit our website at www.strategicgroup.com for more information.Position Summary The People & Culture team at Strategic is dedicated to creating an exceptional employee experience while maintaining strong operational foundations. We are seeking aPeople Operations Leadto join our team, reporting to the Director of People & Culture. This role will own the operational side of People & Culture, overseeing the full employee lifecycle, including benefits administration, HR systems and procedures, onboarding and offboarding, reporting, compliance activities, and employee inquiries. It is an ideal opportunity for an HR professional who is proactive in creating structure, implementing processes, and driving operational excellence. This is a hands-on role where you will shape and manage the processes that keep People & Culture running smoothly across all facets of HR. Key Responsibilities People Operations & Systems Administration Manage employee lifecycle processes, including onboarding, offboarding, and employment eligibility (I-9) verification, ensuring compliance, timely documentation, and a consistent employee experience. Serve as administrator for HR systems, ensuring data accuracy and reporting integrity. Maintain personnel files and employee records in compliance with company policy and legal standards. Assist with coordination and execution of annual people processes, including systems workflows for performance management, goal setting, compensation review and adjustments, and related reporting. Draft, update, and document People & Culture policies, procedures, and the employee handbook. Prepare regular and ad-hoc People reports and analytics for leadership, client RFPs, and Board reporting. Support immigration sponsorship processes in partnership with employees, managers, and external counsel. Support compliance activities, including audits and other required reviews. Gain exposure to employee relations and manager coaching, supporting the Director of People & Culture with documentation and follow-up while building skills in this area. Benefits Administration & Wellness Administer employee benefits programs (medical, dental, vision, 401k, and other offerings). Partner directly with the benefits broker and vendors on program management, renewals, escalations, and compliance. Lead the annual open enrollment process, including employee communication, vendor coordination, and system updates. Serve as the primary point of contact for employees regarding benefits enrollment, changes, and claims inquiries. Manage employee accommodations and leaves of absence, including FMLA, STD, and LTD. Lead 401(k) plan administration, compliance testing, and annual audit. Manage employee wellness initiatives as part of the overall benefits program Talent Talent Acquisition Support Assist business leaders with recruitment for select roles (interns, analysts, and other openings as assigned). Draft, issue, and process offer letters in partnership with hiring managers. Support campus recruiting programs, including scheduling, candidate communication, and career fair participation. Contribute to the design and delivery of onboarding programs for interns, analysts, and new hires. Learning, Development & Engagement Support and facilitate employee learning and development initiatives, including training logistics, system tracking, and evaluation. Assist in employee engagement surveys, including reporting, analysis, and follow-up action plans. Coordinate recognition programs and milestone celebrations (e.g., service awards). Act as a cultural ambassador, modeling organizational values and supporting internal social initiatives. Payroll Support Provide support and oversight for payroll administration, serving as a designated backup to the payroll administrator and assisting with initial or secondary payroll review and approval. Assist in investigating and resolving payroll inquiries or discrepancies in collaboration with the payroll administrator and vendor. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required; Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field preferred Certification in Human Resources or related field (SHRM-CP, PHR) preferred. In-depth knowledge of federal, state, and local industry-specific regulations and best practices and experience with ensuring compliance. Minimum of 5 years of experience, with at least 2 years of experience in managing people or programs; 3 years of Benefits management preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills; Comfortable with public speaking and delivering employee communications and training. Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality and professionalism. Proactive and independent, with the confidence to take ownership of tasks while knowing when to ask questions or bring in leadership for support. Highly organized with experience managing multiple projects; Proven ability to balance multiple competing priorities and deliverables while managing stakeholder expectations. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) HRIS platforms. Excel reporting and analysis required, including pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, and the ability to accurately merge data from multiple sources. Employee must be able to perform the essential functions of the job satisfactorily and, if requested, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable employees with disabilities to perform the essentials functions of the job, absent undue hardship. Strategic is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against staff members or applicants for employment on any legally-recognized basis including, but not limited to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, age or veteran status. title: People Operations Coordinator
description: Ascentec Engineering is hiring a People Operations Coordinator who will support the Human Resources (HR) team by assisting with daily people operations activities and ensuring efficient processes, data accuracy, and positive employee experiences throughout the employee's lifecycle. Key areas include onboarding coordination, employee data management, leave administration, HR reporting, offboarding, events planning, and general HR support. This position is on-site (not remote/not hybrid) at our Tualatin, Oregon location and one day per week at our Dallas, Oregon location. This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship or transfer of Visa sponsorship. Core Responsibilities: Coordinates and facilitates weekly new-hire orientation to deliver a consistent and engaging onboarding experience. Manages onboarding tasks after offer acceptance, including initiating background checks, drug screens, and collecting documentation (I-9 forms, verification, and E-Verify). Coordinates with IT to ensure new-hire equipment, workstation, and system access are prepared before start dates. Processes employee actions in Paylocity, including hires, terminations, transfers, and status changes, ensuring data accuracy and timely entry. Assists with terminations, ensuring the offboarding process is followed, including completed documentation, updated systems, and adherence to compliance requirements. Conducts or distributes exit surveys to departing employees, documents reasons for separation, and ensures rehire eligibility status is clearly recorded. Responds to employment verification requests and processes unemployment claims accurately and promptly. Administers leaves of absence (FMLA, OFLA, Paid Leave Oregon), coordinating with employees, managers, and third-party administrators through return-to-work. Maintains accurate and confidential employee records and ensures data integrity across all HR systems. Maintains a library of current job descriptions for all positions, updating them as titles or responsibilities change. Ensures the organizational chart reflects current reporting structures across the organization. Supports building and tracking HR metrics, including turnover, headcount, time-to-fill, and other key people data as directed. Provides administrative and reporting support to the HR team, including metrics, correspondence, and tracking logs. Supports HR initiatives such as engagement programs, compliance training, and policy implementation. Collaborates with the HR team and other internal groups to plan and coordinate events, meetings, and employee engagement activities. Demonstrates Ascentec core values: Customer Focus, Employee Growth, Trust and Integrity, Operational Excellence, Acts Like an Owner. Maintains regular, predictable attendance. Performs other duties as assigned. Minimum Requirements: Education/Certifications: Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field Experience: 1–3 years of HR or administrative experience. Experience with Paylocity preferred. Familiarity with leave administration (FMLA, OFLA, Paid Leave Oregon) and ADA accommodation processes, as well as general employment compliance practices. Knowledge Skills & Abilities: Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Proven commitment to data accuracy and confidentiality. Excellent customer service and written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Proficient in HR systems, Microsoft Office Suite, and data reporting tools. Valid driver's license and access to reliable transportation. Mental/Physical Demands: Prolonged sitting and computer use. Ability to navigate stairs and move through office and production areas. Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds. Fast-paced environment with frequent interruptions. The employee must be able to perform the essential functions of the position satisfactorily and, if requested, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable employees with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job, absent undue hardship. The employer retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position. Compensation / Benefits: $55,000 to $65,000 per year Paid time off / Holiday pay Medical/Dental/Vision coverage Short- and long-term disability coverage 401(k) with matching funds Profit sharing eligibility Educational aid program availability Applicant must be able to pass a drug screen and criminal background check prior to employment. ITAR REQUIREMENTS: To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Ascentec Engineering is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with Ascentec Engineering is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status. title: People Operations Associate
company: Aberdeen Proving Ground Federal Credit Union
description: Role SummaryWe are seeking a detail-oriented and employee-centric People Operations Associate to join our People Team, with a primary focus on payroll administration, HRIS management, and benefits coordination. This role is ideal for an HR professional who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment and is passionate about ensuring a seamless and positive employee experience throughout the employee lifecycle—from talent acquisition to talent management. The People Operations Associate will serve as a key partner in maintaining data integrity, supporting payroll processes, administering benefits, and contributing to compliance and reporting efforts. This role will collaborate closely with the Talent Acquisition, Talent Management and Employee Experience teams to ensure operational excellence and a consistent, high-quality experience for employees. Key Responsibilities Payroll Administration• Support bi-weekly payroll processing in partnership with Payroll Administrator.• Validate payroll data including salary and rate information, 401k changes and benefit deductions.• Assist with audits and reconciliation of payroll-related data. HRIS Management• Maintain data integrity in HRIS including new hires, terminations, transfers, and benefit changes.• Perform mass data updates, imports/exports, and troubleshoot data discrepancies.• Provide employee support for HRIS navigation, login issues, and self-service tools. Benefits Administration• Administer employee benefits programs including medical, dental, vision, FSAs, 401(k), COBRA, tuition reimbursement, and leave management.• Coordinate plan enrollments, changes, and terminations.• Support wellness initiatives and employee education on total rewards. Talent Management Support• Partner with the collective People Teams on onboarding, orientation, and employee relations matters.• Respond to employment verifications, unemployment requests and support documentation for separations. Compliance & Reporting• Ensure compliance with federal and state employment laws and internal policies.• Support the NMLS administration and audit process.• Generate routine and ad hoc HR reports and assist with vendor invoice processing. Special Projects• Support various team initiatives• Participate in cross-functional projects that enhance the employee experience. Qualifications• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field required.• HR Certifications: PHR preferred.• Experience: Minimum of 5 years in an HR capacity with direct experience in payroll, HRIS, and benefits administration.• Technical Skills: Proficiency in Workday and Microsoft Office Suite.• Knowledge: Strong understanding of employment laws (FMLA, ADA, ADEA, Workers Comp, EEO).• Attributes: High attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and ability to handle sensitive information with discretion. Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.• High emotional intelligence and a commitment to modeling the behaviors that foster a positive and inclusive workplace culture. How You Show Up: Core Competencies• Operational Excellence: You ensure accuracy and efficiency in payroll, HRIS, and benefits processes.• Empathy & Inclusion: You support employees with compassion and responsiveness.• Integrity & Trust: You handle confidential matters with professionalism and discretion.• Agility & Resilience: You adapt quickly to changing priorities and thrive in a dynamic environment.• Collaboration: You build strong relationships across the People Team and organization.• Data-Driven Decision Making: You use data to inform actions and improve processes.• Customer Centricity: You prioritize employee experience in every interaction. What Success Looks Like• Seamless Payroll & Benefits Operations: Timely and accurate processing with minimal errors.• HRIS Accuracy: Clean, reliable data that supports reporting and decision-making.• Employee Experience: Positive feedback from employees on HR support and responsiveness.• Compliance Confidence: Audits passed with minimal findings and proactive risk mitigation.• Team Collaboration: Strong partnerships with Talent Acquisition, Talent Management and Employee Experience teams. Compensation information:Offers are based on experience and education. $63,440.00 - $79,289.60 annually APGFCU provides comprehensive benefits such as: medical and dental (shared expense), vision, 401(k), life and disability insurance, flexible spending account, employee assistance program, referral program, educational assistance, holidays, annual leave and sick leave. APGFCU is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability to Protected Veteran status. Please use the attached link to view the EEO law posterhttp://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm APGFCU is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to persons of all abilities, including persons with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send to the Human Resources Department and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodations will be responded to from this e-mail address. title: People Operations Specialist
description: Reports to: FLSA: Employment Status: About The Woodruff Arts Center The Woodruff Arts Center is a leading arts institution in Atlanta, Georgia, encompassing the Alliance Theatre, the Atlanta Symphony Orchestra, and the High Museum of Art. We are committed to fostering a vibrant arts community, enriching lives through exceptional artistic experiences and educational programs. Position Summary The People Operations Specialist plays a vital role in supporting the Human Resources team at The Woodruff Arts Center. This position provides comprehensive operational and administrative support, ensuring efficient and effective HR processes across all three divisions. The People Operations Specialist will maintain accurate employee records, support recruitment and onboarding, coordinate benefits and payroll processes, generate reports, and provide exceptional service to employees throughout the employee lifecycle. In this role, you will also contribute to creating a positive and inclusive workplace culture that supports the artists, staff, and community of The Woodruff Arts Center. The position offers opportunities to grow expertise in HR systems, compliance, and employee experience initiatives. Responsibilities HR Operations & Compliance Provide operational and administrative support to the Chief Human Resources Officer and the HR team. Handle sensitive employee information with discretion and professionalism. Monitor the Woodruff Arts Center Human Resources (WACHR) inbox and route/respond to inquiries as appropriate. Process invoices, expenses, and purchase orders; manage HR office supply orders. Assist with policy administration, updates, and compliance reporting. Partner with Payroll team on employee changes, deductions, and audits to ensure accurate processing. Support the preparation of reports, dashboards, and presentations for leadership. Onboarding & Employee Lifecycle Coordinate Employment Eligibility Verification (I-9 forms) and E-Verify compliance in Workday. Support new hire onboarding including invitations, first-day preparation, setup, and facilitation. Conduct background checks for new hires & rehires. Support weekly employee terminations, including related parking and Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority (MARTA) adjustments. Maintain accurate employee records in the Human Resources Information System (HRIS), Workday. Leave, Benefits, and Wellness Support administration of Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) and Workers’ Compensation cases. Assist with benefits reconciliation and employee inquiries. Coordinate wellness programming and employee wellness events. Coordinate health and safety trainings for staff. Learning, Volunteer, and Engagement Format and maintain Workday Learning content. Coordinate volunteer programs including applications, training, and oversight. Provide administrative support for volunteer engagement initiatives. Assist with employee engagement events and recognition programs. Employee Support & Experience Serve as the first point of contact for employee inquiries regarding policies, benefits, and systems, escalating issues as needed. Support parking and MARTA benefit coordination. Respond to employee questions through case management and ensure timely resolution. Help ensure a consistent and positive employee experience across all HR programs. Data, Systems, and Process Improvement Generate and maintain standard reports and audits in Workday to ensure data accuracy and compliance. Assist with Workday testing, integrations, and process improvements in partnership with IT and HR leadership. Identify opportunities to streamline HR processes and enhance employee-facing services. Work Schedule Monday – Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM Hybrid schedule; typically includes a combination of remote and in-office work each week (number of in-office days subject to organizational needs). Qualifications Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field preferred (or equivalent experience). Minimum of 4 years of experience in an administrative or operational support role, preferably within Human Resources. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Experience with HRIS systems (e.g., Workday, ADP) is a plus. Skills and Abilities Strong organizational and time management skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information. High attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work independently and collaboratively. A passion for the arts and supporting a vibrant cultural community is a plus. Physical Demands / Work Environment Some standing, walking, bending, frequent use of hands, stooping, and light lifting (at least 20 pounds) required. Noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. title: People Operations Manager
description: ABOUT BASETEN Baseten powers inference for the world's most dynamic AI companies, like OpenEvidence, Clay, Mirage, Gamma, Sourcegraph, Writer, Abridge, Bland, and Zed. By uniting applied AI research, flexible infrastructure, and seamless developer tooling, we enable companies operating at the frontier of AI to bring cutting-edge models into production. With our recent $150M Series D funding, backed by investors including BOND, IVP, Spark Capital, Greylock, and Conviction, we’re scaling our team to meet accelerating customer demand. THE ROLE As a People Operations Manager at Baseten, you’ll play a critical role in building and maintaining the HR infrastructure that enables our team to grow and thrive. You’ll manage our HRIS and PEO, oversee compliance and benefits administration, and coordinate with vendors, EOR partners, and immigration counsel to make sure everything runs seamlessly behind the scenes. This role is perfect for someone who loves the operational side of people work and keeping the many moving pieces of a growing company’s people infrastructure in sync. Your work will ensure that every employee’s experience is clear, consistent, and compliant, enabling our rapidly growing team to focus on their work and our mission. title: Manager, People Operations
description: Airwallex is the only unified payments and financial platform for global businesses. Powered by our unique combination of proprietary infrastructure and software, we empower over 150,000 businesses worldwide – including Brex, Rippling, Navan, Qantas, SHEIN and many more – with fully integrated solutions to manage everything from business accounts, payments, spend management and treasury, to embedded finance at a global scale. Proudly founded in Melbourne, we have a team of over 1,800 of the brightest and most innovative people in tech across 26 offices around the globe. Valued at US$6.2 billion and backed by world-leading investors including Visa, Airtree, Blackbird, Sequoia, DST Global, Greenoaks, Salesforce Ventures, Lone Pine, and Square Peg, Airwallex is leading the charge in building the global payments and financial platform of the future. If you’re ready to do the most ambitious work of your career, join us. We hire successful builders with founder-like energy who want real impact, accelerated learning, and true ownership. You bring strong role-related expertise and sharp thinking, and you’re motivated by our mission and operating principles. You move fast with good judgment, dig deep with curiosity, and make decisions from first principles, balancing speed and rigor. You're humble and collaborative; turn zero‑to‑one ideas into real products, and you “get stuff done” end-to-end. You use AI to work smarter and solve problems faster. Here, you’ll tackle complex, high‑visibility problems with exceptional teammates and grow your career as we build the future of global banking. If that sounds like you, let’s build what’s next. The People & Talent team at Airwallex is dedicated to attracting and developing the brightest and most ambitious minds to drive our company forward. We are a global, vibrant, and dynamic team with a focus on creating a positive and inclusive work environment that fosters growth and innovation. Through innovative programs, strategic People & Talent initiatives, and a deep understanding of our organization’s needs, we cultivate a collaborative and engaging environment that fuels Airwallex's continued growth and success. This role will lead and scale the People Ops function for the Americas, building the systems, processes, and team that deliver a seamless employee experience from onboarding through offboarding while ensuring accuracy, compliance, and operational excellence across HRIS, payroll, benefits/LOA, immigration, and EOR workflows. You’ll be a hands-on builder and people leader who standardizes SOPs, elevates service quality, and partners closely with Payroll, IT, Compliance, Finance/AP, and our global People & Talent team to keep our operations tight, data-driven, and audit-ready. This role is based in San Francisco. Lead and develop the regional People Operations function; own end-to-end employee lifecycle operations (onboarding/orientation, background checks, HRIS data integrity, payroll inputs/changes, benefits and leaves, offboarding) with a strong focus on delivery quality and compliance. Lead and develop the regional People Operations function; own end-to-end employee lifecycle operations (onboarding/orientation, background checks, HRIS data integrity, payroll inputs/changes, benefits and leaves, offboarding) with a strong focus on delivery quality and compliance. title: Manager, People Operations
description: About DAT DATis an award-winning employer of choice and a next-generation SaaS technology company that has been at the leading edge of innovation in transportation supply chain logistics for 45 years. We continue to transform the industry year over year, by deploying a suite of software solutions to millions of customers every day - customers who depend on DAT for the most relevant data and most accurate insights to help them make smarter business decisions and run their companies more profitably. We operate the largest marketplace of its kind in North America, with 400 million freights posted in 2022, and a database of $150 billion of annual global shipment market transaction data. Our headquarters are in Denver, CO, and Beaverton, OR, with additional offices in Seattle, WA; Springfield, MO; and Bangalore, India. For additional information, see www.DAT.com/company Job Application Deadline: 11/1/2025 Position OverviewAs Manager, People Operations at DAT, you'll lead strategic HR initiatives that enhance teammate experiences and drive operational excellence across our growing organization. Reporting to the Director of Talent Operations, you'll spearhead process improvements, modernizing ways of working, policy development, and cross-functional projects that scale our people operations efficiently while ensuring compliance and data integrity. You'll combine strategic thinking with hands-on analytics to optimize HR processes, lead transformational projects, and collaborate with senior leadership on initiatives that support DAT's rapid growth. Your role spans process innovation, change management, data analysis, and ensuring seamless experiences across onboarding, performance management, and career development. Strategic Operations & Process Innovation Design and implement scalable HR processes that enhance teammate experience and operational efficiency Develop & deliver AI driven solutions to enable employees to find the information they need with ease, and improve ways of working Spearhead change management for the People team, ensuring successful adoption of new systems, automations, and process improvements in collaboration with key stakeholders. Continuously audit and refine HR processes, ensuring our documentation and systems remain compliant and aligned with a modern, self-service approach. efficiency, compensation equity, and employee engagement Partner with HR team on UKG, Greenhouse, and Radford system optimization and reporting enhancements Ensure data accuracy and governance across title: People Operations Lead
description: Alt is unlocking the value of alternative assets, starting with the $5 B trading-card market. We let collectors buy, sell, vault, and finance their cards in one place and we are backed by leaders at Stripe, Coinbase, Seven Seven Six, and pro athletes like Tom Brady and Giannis Antetokounmpo. Our next frontier is real-time pricing at scale—the Alt Value that powers every trade, loan, and product on the platform. We’re looking for a People Operations Lead to serve as the architect and driver of our company’s people and recruitment management processes. This role is about more than filling roles; it’s about building and nurturing a team that believes in our mission and thrives in our culture. You’ll own both the recruiting engine that fuels our growth and the people systems that make Alt a great place to work, from compensation and performance design to engagement and retention. Manage the full recruiting lifecycle—from designing job postings and interview processes to managing candidate pipelines and closing offers. This also includes helping build out our recruiting team as we scale. Partner with hiring managers to define role requirements, build structured interview loops, and ensure every candidate has a seamless experience. Manage inbound candidates and external sourcing channels/recruiters (e.g., Paraform) to ensure an efficient and transparent hiring process. Maintain a clean ATS (Applicant Tracking System) and create reports and dashboards to drive visibility into the recruiting process. Act as a strong advocate for our brand, clearly articulating who we are, what we do, and why top talent should join us. Oversee onboarding from offer acceptance through the first 90 days, ensuring every new hire has the resources, clarity, and support to succeed. Partner with managers to create structured 90-day success plans and performance checkpoints. Coordinate visa sponsorships, renewals, and work authorization verification in partnership with external counsel. Partner with leadership on annual compensation and bonus review cycles. Design and maintain compensation structures, pay bands, and incentive programs aligned with company goals and market benchmarks. This includes managing the equity grant process, vesting schedules, and exercise procedures in partnership with Finance and Legal. Educate employees on equity compensation and coordinate with third-party administrators. Process payroll through Rippling, ensuring accuracy and timeliness. Manage open enrollment, new hire benefits setup, and qualifying life event changes. This includes answering employee questions and escalations related to benefits. Maintain compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws across all employee locations. Manage Deel for international employees (onboarding, payroll, compliance). Manage tax filings, unemployment claims, workers’ compensation, and proper employment classification (FTE, contractor, international). Oversee contractor relationships and accounts (e.g., First Factory, Toptal). Partner with the executive team on organizational design, workforce planning, and headcount forecasting to support growth. Build scalable frameworks for performance reviews, goal-setting, and feedback across the organization. Lead biannual performance cycles, including reviews for CEO direct reports. Partner with managers to establish clear career frameworks, leveling guides, and development plans that promote fairness and transparency. Design and implement scalable L&D programs including new manager training, leadership development pathways, and role-specific skill building. Implement quarterly pulse-check surveys to ensure employees feel heard and to proactively identify engagement or retention risks. Own the People Operations budget and provide monthly variance analysis to Finance. Prepare quarterly board reporting on key people metrics including retention, hiring velocity, and engagement scores. Maintain and update the employee handbook to ensure policies reflect current practices and compliance standards. As needed, manage the offboarding process including exit paperwork, benefits termination, equipment return, and system access removal. Conduct exit interviews and track turnover data to identify trends and improve retention. Own IT application management, including permissions, access provisioning, and offboarding. Establish and maintain computer ordering, setup, and shipping workflows. Partner with IT vendors/contractors to resolve employee technical issues. Conduct annual People vendor reviews to ensure we're getting optimal value and service. Serve as a culture ambassador, ensuring our values are embedded throughout the employee lifecycle. Champion initiatives that strengthen connection, recognition, and belonging across a distributed team. Support planning and execution of company-wide events, including the annual offsite. 7+ years of experience in an HR/People Ops role at a startup or high-growth company Deep understanding of our mission and the space we operate in—you want to champion what we do, not just manage processes. Experience spanning both recruiting and HR functions. Proven ability to design, implement, and analyze metric-driven compensation frameworks, performance systems, and employee engagement programs. Strong organizational skills and ability to balance day-to-day execution with longer-term planning. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to inspire candidates and build trust across all levels of the company. A chance to shape the culture and employee experience at a fast-moving, mission-driven company Hands-on exposure to both HR and recruiting processes with growth opportunities ahead $100/month work-from-home stipend $200/month wellness stipend WeWork office stipend 401(k) retirement benefits Flexible vacation policy Generous paid parental leave Competitive healthcare benefits, including HSA, for you and your dependent(s) Base salary range:$180,000-$200,000, plus equity. Actual offer may vary based on experience, location, and other factors. title: People Operations Specialist
description: People Operations SpecialistAbout CarvanaAt Carvana, we're changing the way people buy and sell cars. With an ambitious vision and a fundamentally different approach designed to be fun, fast, and fair, Carvana became the fastest-growing automotive retailer in history. We expanded nationally, went public on the New York Stock Exchange, sold our 1 millionth car, and reached the Fortune 500, all in just eight years. Today, with 4 million retail customers and counting, Carvana is both the fastest-growing and the most profitable public automotive retailer, and we're just getting started. We continue to raise the bar for our customers as we tackle the enormous opportunity still ahead in the largest consumer vertical. Working here means being part of a team that embraces change, celebrates creative problem solving, and always strives to be better. At Carvana, you'll have the opportunity to take on meaningful challenges, learn quickly, and help shape the future of automotive retail. If you're driven to grow and make an impact as part of a collaborative team, you'll fit right in. Learn more about what it's like to work here from the people that already do. About the team and positionThis isn't your average HR role. You'll be the crucial link between our teammates and the business, ensuring that every person at Carvana feels supported and treated with respect during complex life events. As our People Operations Specialist focused on Leaves and Accommodations, you're not just an administrator—you're an internal customer service champion and an expert advisor. You balance team member support with accountability to drive efficient processes that meet key business needs. This is a fully on-site position, Monday through Friday, at our corporate HQ in Tempe, Arizona. What you'll be doing We're looking for someone who treats every interaction as an opportunity to provide amazing service to our team members and leaders. Own the Process: Take full, end-to-end accountability for the administration of all Leaves of Absence (LOA) and Accommodation (ADA) requests—from initial inquiry to return-to-work clearance. Be the Expert & Advisor: Establish yourself as the go-to knowledge source for all Carvana teammates and leaders, providing clear, radically simple answers on parental, medical, military, and other leave policies. Proactive Partnership: Don't wait for issues to escalate. You will proactively partner with leaders to find solutions, resolve concerns, and strategically align team member needs with business goals. Facilitate the Conversation: Lead sensitive, confidential discussions (Interactive Process) with empathy and firmness to determine reasonable workplace accommodations. Improve Everything (Low Ego/High Learning): We don't settle for "good enough." You will look for friction points, streamline processes, and remain continuously inquisitive. Maintain Precision: Ensure impeccable data integrity and communication flow, confirming that all leaves are administered in accordance with federal and state regulations (FMLA, ADA, etc.). What you should have/knowThe Skills & Experience: 2+ years of experience in Human Resources, or in administering Leaves of Absence, Accommodations, or other related, high-volume, employee service-oriented work. A solid grasp of (or willingness to learn) federal and state compliance laws related to LOA and accommodations (FMLA, ADA, PWFA, STD/LTD). Experience with Workday is a big plus. The Cultural Fit (This is non-negotiable): Customer Service Obsession: You genuinely love helping people, and you define success by how clear and painless you make a challenging process for team members and leaders. High Accountability & Ownership: If you own a task, it gets done right, on time, and completely. You don't pass the buck or make excuses. A Willingness to Learn: You check your ego at the door. You thrive on feedback, see every mistake as a chance to improve a process, and are constantly looking to level up your knowledge. You lead with smart thinking and common sense, not just policy. You navigate highly confidential information with the highest degree of discretion and professionalism. You translate complex policies into clear, actionable language for both senior leaders and team members. Don't Meet 100% of the Qualifications?At Carvana, we value diverse backgrounds and experiences. We encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't fit every single bullet point. Give it a shot—we'd love to hear from you! What we'll offer in return Full-Time position with a competitive salary. Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits. 401K with company match. A multitude of perks including student loan payments, discounts on vehicles, benefits for your pets, and much more. A great wellness program to keep you healthy and happy both physically and mentally. Access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others across the organization. A company culture focused on high performance and bar-raising, with vast opportunity to learn and grow. Other requirementsTo be able to do your job at Carvana, there are some basic requirements we want to share with you. Must be able to read, write, speak, and understand English. Of course, we'll make any reasonable accommodations for those with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their jobs. Legal stuffHiring is contingent on passing a complete background check. This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship. Carvana is an equal employment opportunity employer. All applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Carvana also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories. title: People Operations Specialist
description: People Operations SpecialistAbout CarvanaAt Carvana, we’re changing the way people buy and sell cars. With an ambitious vision and a fundamentally different approach designed to be fun, fast, and fair, Carvana became the fastest-growing automotive retailer in history. We expanded nationally, went public on the New York Stock Exchange, sold our 1 millionth car, and reached the Fortune 500, all in just eight years. Today, with 4 million retail customers and counting, Carvana is both the fastest-growing and the most profitable public automotive retailer, and we’re just getting started. We continue to raise the bar for our customers as we tackle the enormous opportunity still ahead in the largest consumer vertical. Working here means being part of a team that embraces change, celebrates creative problem solving, and always strives to be better. At Carvana, you’ll have the opportunity to take on meaningful challenges, learn quickly, and help shape the future of automotive retail. If you’re driven to grow and make an impact as part of a collaborative team, you’ll fit right in. Learn more about what it’s like to work here from the people that already do. About the team and positionThis isn't your average HR role. You'll be the crucial link between our teammates and the business, ensuring that every person at Carvana feels supported and treated with respect during complex life events. As our People Operations Specialist focused on Leaves and Accommodations, you’re not just an administrator—you’re an internal customer service champion and an expert advisor. You balance team member support with accountability to drive efficient processes that meet key business needs. This is a fully on-site position, Monday through Friday, at our corporate HQ in Tempe, Arizona. What you’ll be doing We’re looking for someone who treats every interaction as an opportunity to provide amazing service to our team members and leaders. Own the Process: Take full, end-to-end accountability for the administration of all Leaves of Absence (LOA) and Accommodation (ADA) requests—from initial inquiry to return-to-work clearance. Be the Expert & Advisor: Establish yourself as the go-to knowledge source for all Carvana teammates and leaders, providing clear, radically simple answers on parental, medical, military, and other leave policies. Proactive Partnership: Don't wait for issues to escalate. You will proactively partner with leaders to find solutions, resolve concerns, and strategically align team member needs with business goals. Facilitate the Conversation: Lead sensitive, confidential discussions (Interactive Process) with empathy and firmness to determine reasonable workplace accommodations. Improve Everything (Low Ego/High Learning): We don't settle for "good enough." You will look for friction points, streamline processes, and remain continuously inquisitive. Maintain Precision: Ensure impeccable data integrity and communication flow, confirming that all leaves are administered in accordance with federal and state regulations (FMLA, ADA, etc.). What you should have/knowThe Skills & Experience: 2+ years of experience in Human Resources, or in administering Leaves of Absence, Accommodations, or other related, high-volume, employee service-oriented work. A solid grasp of (or willingness to learn) federal and state compliance laws related to LOA and accommodations (FMLA, ADA, PWFA, STD/LTD). Experience with Workday is a big plus. The Cultural Fit (This is non-negotiable): Customer Service Obsession: You genuinely love helping people, and you define success by how clear and painless you make a challenging process for team members and leaders. High Accountability & Ownership: If you own a task, it gets done right, on time, and completely. You don't pass the buck or make excuses. A Willingness to Learn: You check your ego at the door. You thrive on feedback, see every mistake as a chance to improve a process, and are constantly looking to level up your knowledge. You lead with smart thinking and common sense, not just policy. You navigate highly confidential information with the highest degree of discretion and professionalism. You translate complex policies into clear, actionable language for both senior leaders and team members. Don't Meet 100% of the Qualifications?At Carvana, we value diverse backgrounds and experiences. We encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't fit every single bullet point. Give it a shot—we'd love to hear from you! What we’ll offer in return Full-Time position with a competitive salary. Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits. 401K with company match. A multitude of perks including student loan payments, discounts on vehicles, benefits for your pets, and much more. A great wellness program to keep you healthy and happy both physically and mentally. Access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others across the organization. A company culture focused on high performance and bar-raising, with vast opportunity to learn and grow. Other requirementsTo be able to do your job at Carvana, there are some basic requirements we want to share with you. Must be able to read, write, speak, and understand English. Of course, we’ll make any reasonable accommodations for those with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their jobs. Legal stuffHiring is contingent on passing a complete background check. This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship. Carvana is an equal employment opportunity employer. All applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Carvana also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. title: People Operations Specialist
description: Do you want to be a part of the clean energy movement? Are you passionate about improving our environment for this generation and those to follow? Are you ready to take on new challenges and collaborate with a future-focused team leading the way into new markets? Join Nexamp! This is where you can learn from industry leaders and become one yourself. It's fast-paced, mission-based work that challenges the status quo. Be on the team that's changing the world. What we’re looking for: Nexamp is looking to hire a People Operations Specialist. In this role, you will be responsible for the administration of all company benefits and leaves of absence as well as a variety of other operational projects and tasks to support the People team. This role demands meticulous attention to detail, a deep understanding of policies and procedures, and the ability to handle and communicate sensitive information with discretion. You will be hybrid out of our Boston Office, with 3 days a week expected. You will report to the Director, People Operations. What you’ll do: Manage the administration of employee benefits programs such as health, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, and COBRA. Provide guidance and assistance to employees on benefits inquiries and issues, ensuring they receive timely and accurate information. Work with vendors and management on any escalations. Manage the leave of absence process, including partnering with our vendor to ensure compliance with all state and federal laws. Maintain company intranet, ensuring all documents and materials are up to date and accurate, and that employees have quick access to information. Project manage annual open enrollment, including entering new rates/plans into HRIS system, helping to create employee communications, and providing vendors with enrollment data. Conduct regular audits to ensure all enrollments match between our vendors and payroll system. Address any discrepancies and implement corrective actions as needed to maintain consistency between all systems. Review and audit all bills related to benefits; address discrepancies as needed and submit to AP for processing. Lead the Benefits section of New Hire Orientation on a bi-weekly basis; hold benefits trainings as needed. Administer compliance training via our third-party platform. Ensure all employees are assigned the appropriate new hire and annual trainings, per state law. Manage the visa application process for new and existing employees requiring work authorization. Act as a liaison between employees, legal representatives, and management to ensure proper documentation and compliance with immigration laws. Act as back-up for Payroll as needed, including processing and confirming accuracy of bi-weekly payroll process. Work on special projects, as needed. What you’ll bring: Minimum of 3 years of demonstrated experience in benefits and leave administration. Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently. Flexible and ability to pivot quickly as business needs arise. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with a keen eye for detail. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, capable of handling sensitive situations with diplomacy and confidentiality. Proficiency in HRIS systems and reporting tools. Commitment to Nexamp's mission and have a passion for solving tomorrow's climate crisis today. Demonstrated experience in effectively communicating information, ideas, and perspectives with people inside and beyond your organization. Experience in showcasing initiative to make improvements to current work, processes, products, and services across the organization. We value accountability and an ownership mentality. Ability to ask appropriate questions, analyze data, identify the root causes of problems, and present creative solutions. Expertise in building strong internal and external relationships with customers and stakeholders, instilling trust and loyalty across the industry. Eagerness to develop a fundamental understanding of how Nexamp operates and then apply that knowledge effectively to inform business decisions. If you don’t meet 100% of the above qualifications, but see yourself contributing, please apply. At Nexamp, our mission is to build the future of energy so it is clean, simple, and accessible for all. We are committed to providing a work environment free from discrimination. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against applicants on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. By encouraging a culture where ideas and decisions come from all people, we believe it will help us grow, innovate, and be a part of environmental and social change. You’ll love working here because: Not only will you get to take part in meaningful work and have the chance to change the world alongside innovative, dedicated, and motivated peers, but you will also have access to all the benefits that Nexamp offers! This includes our competitive compensation package; a 401(k) employer-match; health, dental, and vision insurance starting day one; flexible paid time off and holiday PTO; commuter benefits, and cell phone reimbursement. We have headquarters in Boston, MA and Chicago, IL, in addition to growing offices nationwide. We provide healthy snacks, coffee, service days and other volunteer opportunities, company outings, and more! Compensation: The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Nexamp ranges from $70,000 - $85,000. In addition to base salary, the competitive compensation package may include, depending on the role, participation in an incentive program linked to performance (for example, annual bonus programs based on individual and company performance, non-annual sales incentive plans, or other non-annual incentive plans). Additionally, you may be eligible to participate in the Company’s stock option plan. Actual base salary may vary based upon, but is not limited to, skills and qualifications, internal equity, performance, and geographic location. Nexamp's People team manages all aspects of recruitment and hiring within our organization. We want to inform third-party recruiters, staffing firms, and related agencies that Nexamp does not accept unsolicited resumes. Resumes will only be considered from these entities if a signed agreement is in place and the People team explicitly authorizes external recruiting assistance for a specific position. Any unsolicited resumes received will be deemed the property of Nexamp. We want to emphasize that Nexamp is not liable for any fees associated with unsolicited resumes.
